El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de un activo fijo que consiste en una planta eléctrica ya que en su comarca falla mucho la luz y por el cuido de su ganado y cerdo la necesita por cualquier pérdida, también para capital de trabajo (cerdos en Pie). Darling agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrecen a las personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Darling Beatriz is 38, married with two young children, she is originally from Chinandega, area where commerce is the main activity, among other activities, she sells pigs, milk that she gets from her own cows and she earns salary as a part time teacher at a school close to Chinandega, with the loans received, Darling has been able to slowly grow her business, one of her dreams is to grow her business more and make improvements to her house, her clientele has been growing.  The loan requested is to buy capital assets in the form of an power generator, because her location has many power failures and she needs power for her livestock business.  Darling is thankful for the support that the Kiva investors provide to people with low financial resources.

loans.use: to buy a power generator for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the grill and air conditioner in his stall.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 36-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and four children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2007, her husband has had been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family’s needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business, as the demands of his clients are increasing day by day. 

Therefore, his wife Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband's store. He will purchase a variety of products including flour, milk packs, eggs, pulses, detergents, oils, etc. to cope with the increased demand of clients. 

Shazia and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for the general store.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 26-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and two children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2010, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family’s needs. Due to the large family size and low monthly income, they are facing many problems. Her husband needs additional capital for the growth of his business. Azra has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can invest in her husband’s shop.

With the loan money, her husband would expand the general store. He would add some more space to it by building one more room. He would also buy a variety of goods like rice, sugar, soap, cereals, milk, and utility items for his general store. This would satisfy his clients more professionally, as well as increase his savings for the better future of his children. The profit amount would be used to expand the business and pay the household expenses.

Azra and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to expand the general store business and buy a variety of goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make finishing touches to his house

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El señor Isidro es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta vive en una de Choluteca comunidad al sur de Honduras, vive junto con su esposa y sus 3 hijos que lo ayudan a mucho en su negocio.
Don Isidro su negocio es la  compra y venta de cerdos  desde hace 15 años, los cuales  vende desde su casa de habitación, es visitado por los vecinos de su comunidad y demás caseríos cercanos a este.
Don Isidro ocupa el préstamo para la compra de más cerdos porque necesita cubrir la demanda que tiene, espera que gracias al préstamo contar con el producto necesario para  satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y además que sus ventas aumenten y con esto generar mayores ingresos.
Don Isidro desea  mejorar  su estilo de vida y el de su familia y sueña con ver crecer su negocio y con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia para  que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Isidro is a very hardworking and honest person, he lives in Choluteca, a community located south of Honduras, he lives with his wife and three children that support him in his business.  Isidro's business for 15 years has been to buy and sell pigs, he sells them from his home residence, where he is visited by neighbors and locations close to his community.
Isidro needs the loan to buy more pigs because he needs to fill the demand from his clients, he hopes that with the loan he will have the livestock he needs to meet his clients' needs and increase his sales, and this way generate more income.
Isidro wishes to improve his quality of life as well as his family's, he dreams with seeing his business grow and support his family so that his children can finish their studies and become good people that get good opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – April 2013

loans.use: to buy pigs for his business.

loans.name: Malila Group

texts.en:
Veronica is in her late 20s and is married with two children who are still going to school. She has been a food vendor for one year now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Veronica's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to open a shop and to pay the shop's rent. She bought a refrigerator and started selling cold drinks. She restocked the missing items in her food store and has managed to repay all her loans successfully.  She used the profits to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to open another place for food vending. Her dream is to one day be able to own a hotel.

Veronica will share this loan with her loan group, "Malila", with 12 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loans.

loans.use: to open another place for food vending.

loans.name: Syrjan

texts.en:
Syrjan has been operating a small, simple and basic type of village restaurant for the past seven years. He has been serving coffee, snacks, and different appetizers called “Meze” in Albania, including traditional “Qofte, salce kosi, turshi, byrek…,” and also the traditional Albanian drink “raki” made from grapes, plums or different berries.

Syrjan lives in a rural village in southeastern Albania known for delicious foods such as meatballs (kernacka) and also pies (byrek, petanik and lakror), baked in a primitive way using wood coals. The traditional food and the raki mixed with cinnamon and honey and boiled afterwards makes it a favorite region for locals and foreign tourists alike. 

Syrjan now wants to repair the roof of the simple restaurant and invest in the patio’s flooring and a tent with the loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek, which will be his first loan that he is requesting from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his restaurant and build a tent for the patio.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 37 years old and the hardworking mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along her husband and children. She is very skilled woman and she is an expert at stitching dresses. She has been doing this tailoring work for ten years. All the people in her area are very well satisfied and happy with her work. She provides her services at a very reasonable cost, which is why her work is increasing day by day.

Nusrat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business by purchasing one more sewing machine. She would be able to stitch dresses more appropriately and efficiently, in less time, with new sewing machine. This would increase her net income and savings. She would spend the profit amount on the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 36 years old and married to Rose. They both support four people in the family. Stephen has been a butcher for the past eight years with a monthly income of 48,000 KES.

Stephen has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD in the amount of 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase a cow to slaughter for his business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. His hope and dream is to be a successful man.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for his business.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina, 30 years old, is a hardworking mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along her husband and children. She is a very skilled woman and she is an expert at stitching dresses. She has been doing this tailoring work for five years. All the people in her area are very well satisfied and happy with her work. She provides her services at a very reasonable cost, which is why her work is increasing day by day.

Hina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business by purchasing one more sewing machine. She would be able to stitch dresses more appropriately and efficiently and in less time with a new sewing machine. This would increase her net income and savings. She would spend the profit amount on the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 33-year-old hardworking woman living with her husband and three children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. They have three buffalo and her husband sells buffalo milk to their neighbors and other people, which is the only source of income for their family. She wants to sell milk, yogurt and butter in the market on a large scale, for which the production should be increased. Shazia is facing a very difficult time as her monthly income is insufficient to meet household expenses. As a member of four-person group, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to buy a new buffalo in order to increase the production of milk and increase her monthly income. After receiving the profits, she is planning to send her children to school. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

NOTE: In the picture Shazia is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a new buffalo.

loans.name: Daisy M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of16,800,000 SLL for the entire team in other to meet their most pressing financial challenges. They can easily repay the loan. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Iye is the featured leader of this group. A native of Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone, the 30-year-old is a widow with 2 children. Iye has been a school teacher for 30 years now. She has requested for this loan in order to buy materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, cement, iron rods, and other material to construct a house.

loans.use: to buy materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, cement, iron rods, and other material to construct a house.

loans.name: Hameedan's Group

texts.en: Hameedan, 55, is a housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 children. Her husband owns a general store in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of products in his shop. Presently he is interested in purchasing wheat to sell. However, due to the lack of funds he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Hameedan, as a member of two person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase wheat to sell. With the profits, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Hameedan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase wheat to sell.

loans.name: Zumrud

texts.en:
Zumrud is 33 years old. She has dedicated most of her time to caring for her children and administering her store, in which she sells common household items. Thanks to her work, she generates the income necessary to support her family. She loves her work and puts her heart into it. From this business, her monthly profit is 170 AZN.

Zumrud's husband is a worker, but sometimes he also helps her to sell products. She sells tea, sugar, sweets and other items. She does not have enough funds to buy more products for her market. Because of that, Zumrud needs a loan. 

She has already taken 5 loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, she has applied for sixth loan of 2000 AZN. With this money, she wants to invest in her business and buy more products. Her good client history indicates her willingness to repay.

loans.use: to invest in her business and buy more products.

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
Юрий женат. У него есть взрослый сын. Юрий пенсионер и подрабатывает на стройке. Он трудолюбивый, ответственный и искренний человек.

Юрий просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 7500 гривен на ремонт дома. Он хочет поменять два окна и утеплить внешние стены дома пенопластом. Ремонт поможет улучшить жилищные условия его семьи и сбережет драгоценное тепло в зимний сезон.
texts.en:
Yuriy is married and the father of an adult son.  He is retired but works part-time in construction.  He is a hardworking, responsible and sincere man.

Yuriy is requesting a loan of 7,500 hryvnia to renovate his house.  He wants to change two windows and to insulate the walls of his house with foam.

These renovations will help him to improve his family's living conditions and save precious warmth during the winter season.

loans.use: to improve insulation on his house.

loans.name: Elmer José

texts.es:
El señor Elmer José habita en la cuidad de Managua desde casado trabaja  en el área de mantenimiento de  una empresa.

Don Elmer está solicitando un crédito para gastos  médicos ,compra de medicamento y pago de exámenes  ya que ha estado un poco mal de salud  es por esta circunstancia que está solicitando a los inversionistas de kiva  un financiamiento
texts.en:
Elmer José lives in the city of Managua.  He's married and works in the field of maintenance in a business.

Elmer's requesting a loan for medical expenses, to buy medicine and pay for tests because he has been a little sick.  This is why he's requesting a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida is 58 years old and a mother of six children. She is a responsible housewife. She is a poor lady, and her family is facing financial problems due to lack of income. Her husband is a welder by profession. Presently, he is interested in purchasing iron rods, iron sheets, welding rods, soldering rods, etc., to sell, but due to the lack of income, he finds it difficult to purchase. Therefore, Zubaida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband to purchase these items. This will help him to increase his net income and savings in the future. Zubaida is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase iron rods, iron sheets, welding rods, soldering rods, etc., for her husband to sell in his business.

loans.name: Gulfashan

texts.en: Gulfashan is a 28-year-old responsible and hardworking housewife. Her husband is currently working as an auto mechanic. Gulfashan and her husband have been saving money for many years to purchase a van. Gulfashan's husband wants to start his own transport business. For that purpose, Gulfashan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. They would purchase the van and can start their own business. This could solve many of their financial problems. Gulfashan is very much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a van.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина находится в гражданском браке. У нее четверо детей. Ирина имеет свой бизнес. 

Ирине было трудно, когда умер первый муж, и она осталась одна с детьми. Сейчас она занимается продажей одежды, а также мужских и женских духов. Ирина  трудолюбивая, ответственная и искренняя.

Ирина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 5000 гривен на покупку нового холодильника. Холодильный, который есть сейчас нерабочий и все время ломается. Кредит поможет улучшить жилищные условия семьи.
texts.en:
Irina lives in a civil union.  She is the mother of four children and she has her own business.

Irina went through a very difficult time when her first husband died, as she was left alone with her children.  She is now involved in the sale of clothes, as well as men's and women's perfumes.  She is hardworking, responsible and sincere.

Irina is requesting a loan of 5,000 hryvnia for the purchase of a new fridge.  The fridge that she currently owns is not working and is constantly broken.  This loan will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator

loans.name: Feroza

texts.en: Feroza is a 43-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband owns a stitching shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. Presently, he is interesed in purchasing a sewing machine, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of income, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife, Feroza, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the machine. With the profits, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Feroza is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her husband's business.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA VIDA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Irma ella es casada y tiene 58 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa y lencería, la socia vende medias, polos y truzas,la socia vende pantalones, blusas y casacas, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 7 años y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un atienda donde pueda vender la ropa y lencería. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar polos, medias y truzas y también blusas y pantalones.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
El socio que esta tapado con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Nueva Vida
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de ropa, negocio de confeccion de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de libreria.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Nueva Vida Communal Bank, located in the district of Wanchaq in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Irma, is 58 years old and married; she has two children.  She works in her business selling clothing and lingerie.

Irma sells stockings, polo shirts, underpants, pants, blouses, and coats.  She sells on foot from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m.  She has earned a living in this business for seven years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a lingerie and clothing store.

Irma's requesting the loan to buy polo shirts, stockings, and underpants as well as blouses and pants.                                                                                                                                                                                  

The members whose photos are attached to the group photo had permission to have their pictures taken after the reunion because of work.  The member whose face is covered with a circle is no longer in Nueva Vida Communal Bank.

The businesses of the other members are selling clothing, making clothing, a grocery store, and a bookstore.
 
Irma's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan and promises to make her payments by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en:
Hafiz is 58 years old and married with four children. He began his business working to sell products for household use 15 years ago. His goal is to become independent and to improve the economic condition of his family. His profit from this business is 190 AZN. His son helps him sell products.

With the aim of purchasing general merchandise and increasing sales, he is asking for a loan due to his lack of capital. He is certain that his investment will allow him to increase his clients and his income.

He has already taken five loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for his sixth loan, this time for 1800 AZN. With this money, he wants to buy more products and to expand his business in the future. His good client history is a little proof of this.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is 51 years old, married and the father of two children. Tahir is very popular in his region as a good merchant. He is selling pots and pans in his market. He has 20 years of experience in this field. His wife stays at home but sometimes she also helps him to sell goods. The products that his customers like best are those that are used in the kitchen like pots, utensils, pans, buckets, etc.  His profit from this business is 150 AZN.

His shop hours are from eight o'clock in the morning until ten o'clock at night. It is the only business specializing in this sector and there are no other similar shops. He feels happy because thanks to his work, he gets a sense of fulfillment. He really wants to continue working and to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Joven  José de 25 años de edad  es soltero, vive con su madre y su hermana  en una comunidad de San Lorenzo en la  zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a la vente de abarrotería y granos básico.
José  su negocio está en su casa de habitación,  donde le visitan todas la personas de su  aldea  y de aldeas vecinas se dedica al negocio desde hace 2 años,  sus clientes le prefieren por su buena atención y amabilidad.
José  esta el préstamo para la compra de  churros, aguas, café,  refrescos, pan, leches, huevos, manteca, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, etc. Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
José  su sueño es que su  negocio sea más grande.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Abril del 2013
texts.en:
José, 25, is a single young man who lives with his mother and his sister in a community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.  He makes a living selling groceries and basic staples.

José's business is in his house where all the people from his village and from nearby villages visit him.   He has made a living with this business for two years.  His customers prefer him for his good service and friendliness.

José's requesting the loan to buy chips, water, coffee, refreshments, bread, milk, eggs, shortening, beans, sugar, rice, etc.  With the profits and the support of this loan he wants to get ahead and continue improving his income.

José's dream is to have a bigger business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, April 2013

loans.use: to buy food for his business

loans.name: Ganna

texts.ru: Ганна занимается продажей разнообразного товара в своем отделе в местном центральном универмаге, а именно она продает женскую одежду, шторы, спальные одеяла и постельное белье. Этим бизнесом Ганна занимается уже 12 лет. При этом благодаря предыдущему кредиту Ганна заработала достаточно средств, чтобы развить вторую торговую точку по продаже продуктов. В это раз Ганна просит предоставить ей кредит 24,000 гривен на увеличение ассортимента нового товара. Она твердо намерена развивать свой бизнес дальше и наращивать обороты.
texts.en:
Ganna has her own department located inside a local department store and she sells various items such as women's clothes, curtains, blankets and bed linens.  She has been involved in this business for 12 years.

Thanks to her previous loan with Kiva, Ganna has made enough money to develop a second retail outlet where she sells food products.  She is now requesting a loan of 24,000 hryvnia in order to increase her inventory of goods for her new business.

She is very determined to further develop her business and increase her turnover.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of food products at her new retail outlet.

loans.name: Betty S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of schoolteachers from the eastern city of Kenema. They have come together to request a loan of SLL 19,800,000 for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they are empowered to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions making the repayments on their behalf.

Betty is the featured leader of this group. The 53-year-old is a native of Damalow, in eastern Sierra Leone. Betty is a widow with two children, one in secondary school and one in college. Betty has been a schoolteacher for 27 years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for her child.

loans.use: to pay college fees for her child

loans.name: Khurshid

texts.en: Khurshid lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Khurshid has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Khurshid is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en: Mehnaz is 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband owns an embroidery business. Presently, he is interested in purchasing embroidery materials for his business. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Mehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of purchasing the needed things. With the help of the loan, Mehnaz wants to purchase threads, precious stones, etc. for her husband's embroidery business. This will help him to continue his business. Mehnaz is so very thankful for Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase threads, precious stones, etc for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья замужем. У нее есть взрослая дочь. Наталья имеет свой бизнес.

На центральном рынке города Наталья продает солнцезащитные и оптические очки. У нее опыт работы 15 лет. Наталья всегда старается предоставить большой ассортимент покупателям. Наталья также дает услуги ремонта очков.

Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 7000 гривен на закупку новой партии товара. Кредит поможет увеличить доход семьи.
texts.en:
Nataliya is married. She has a grown-up daughter. Nataliya operates her own business.
Nataliya sells sunglasses and reading glasses at the central market of her town. She has 15 years of experience. She always tries to offer a big selection to her customers. She also provides eyeglass repair services.
Nataliya is applying for a loan in the amount of 7,000 UAH to buy a new batch of merchandise. This loan will allow to enhance her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal goods [sunglasses].

loans.name: Abu Boms' Group

texts.en:
Meet this group of teachers from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 12,100,000 leones in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for making the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Abu Boms is the featured leader of this group. This 58-year-old is a native of Tinkoko, in southern Sierra Leone. Abu Boms is married to a teacher and the couple has five children, two of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Abu Boms has been a school teacher for 35 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is 25 years old and a hardworking, diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, alongside her husband and two children. Her husband is a janitor by profession, and he has a very low monthly income. Because of this, they are facing a lot of financial problems.

Nargis  is a very responsible and skilled woman. She is using her tailoring skills to generate an additional source of income for her family. She is very experienced in stitching clothes and dresses. She has been doing this work for two years. Her clients are very happy and well-satisfied with her work.
 
She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand her business. She wants to open a tailoring centre in her house. She would purchase two new sewing machines, so that her production would be increased. She would also purchase some thread and fabrics, to use for the stitching. She would pay her installments with the profit amount, and would also pay some household expenses. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a progressive one, for her family.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines, and materials (fabrics and thread) for sewing

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина замужем. У нее трое взрослых сыновей. Валентина живет в доме вместе со своей семьей. Она трудолюбивая. Она работает менеджеров в финансовой компании. Также у нее есть дополнительный доход: изготавливает разные креативные вещи в свадебный салон. Валентина считает доходы и мудро использует заработанное. 

Валентина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 15000 гривен. Она хочет перештукатурить коридор и в целях экономии поменять входную дверь. Сейчас происходит большая утрата тепла из-за того, что дверь старая.
texts.en:
Valentina is married and she the mother of three adult sons.  She lives in a house with her family.  She is a hardworking woman who is employed as a manager in a financial company.  She also makes an additional income designing various creative accessories for a bridal salon.  She keeps track of her earnings and wisely uses the money that she makes.

Valentina is requesting a loan of 15,000 hryvnia.  She wants to renovate her hallway and change her front door, which will help her to save money.  Her current front door is old and causes a major loss of heat.

loans.use: to repair the hallway in her house and to save heat in the winter.

loans.name: Herika Liset

texts.es: Herika Liset de 32 años de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad del domicilio de Chinandega ubicado al occidente del país, el cual se caracteriza por ser una  zona  comercial muy productiva.  Herika es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, que ha tenido que luchar desde muy joven para salir obtener su alimento diario,  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, terminando con costo la secundaria debido a que se vio obligada  a trabajar desde temprana edad para aporta a los gastos del hogar. Por tanto lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro y verlos realizarse como profesionales, ella se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general así como también  posee un pequeño taller de costura en su casa de habitación donde ofrece sus servicios de costura a sus vecinos, las compras las realiza al contado en mercados de mayoreos y tiendas de Chinandega, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito, posee clientes fijos y eventuales todos por encargos y de forma ambulante,  con los financiamientos que ha obtenido ha ido incrementando más su negocio y con mejorando su vivienda, el financiamiento que está solicitando es para invertir en compra de mercadería en general como calzados, cosméticos, shampoo, productos plasticos, al igual que compra de telas, hilos, ajugas, adornos de telas botones, siperes, elasticos, entretelas entre otros para realizar diversos estilos de vestidos, camisas, sabanas, entre otros debido a que se acerca una fecha muy importante que es el día de las Madres y es donde se logra vender más  porque sus pedidos han incrementado, Herika está muy contenta con la ayuda que los inversionistas Kivas les brinda  a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Herika Liset is 32 years old, married, and has two young children.  She lives in Chinandega, located in the western part of the country and known for its commercial production.  Herika is a hardworking, responsible woman who has had to struggle since she was very young in order to be able to eat.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she was not able to attend university.  She finished middle school but saw herself obligated to work at an early age in order to help with the household expenses.  She works hard every day to provide a better future for her children, so that they will have a better future and so that she can see them become professionals.  She buys and sells general merchandise and also has a small sewing workshop in her home, where she provides services to her neighbors.  She makes her purchases at the wholesale markets and stores in Chinandega and sells for cash and credit.  She has fixed customers and takes orders and also sells on foot.  She has used the previous loans to grow her business and make improvements to her house.  She is asking for this loan so she can buy general merchandise such as shoes, cosmetics, shampoo, plastic products, fabrics, threads, needles, decorative fabric, buttons, zippers, elastic, and other things to make various styles of dresses, shirts, sheets, and other things.  An important date is coming up, Mother’s Day, and her orders have increased.  Herika is very grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of limited financial resources.

loans.use: to buy inventory and supplies.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married businessman and runs a transport business. He owns a three-wheeled vehicle, which he has been operating for the last two years. He has three children, all of whom attend school.

Martin was introduced to Milango by his friend and joined to access credit for his business. He is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy spare parts. He believes this loan will help improve the standard of living of his family despite competition and the high cost of fuel experienced in his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Gulmarjan

texts.en:
Gulmarjan is a 38-year-old, married woman. She is an enterprising woman, with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been in the business of selling clothing for almost six years. She purchase clothes from different areas, and she sells them in the main market, at profitable prices.

Gulmarjan is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband makes his living as a daily laborer, and his income, alone, is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members.

To cope with the increasing demand during the summer season, Gulmarjan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to purchase a variety of clothes, in different colors. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of profits on the improvement of her house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothing to resell at the market

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a very diligent and hardworking woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and five children. Her husband has been running a gold shop for six years. Her husband wants to expand the gold shop. So, Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for that purpose. Her husband would add some more space to his shop, and would also improve the seating arrangements for the customers. He would renovate his shop to attract more customers. Sajida is very hopeful about the results of this loan, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To add more space and improve the seating for customers, in the gold shop that is her family's source of income

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
El señor  Rosa  de 34  años de edad  vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación, se dedica al negocio que es la venta de  marisco desde hace 10 años.
 Don Rosa actualmente se dedica a comprar marisco como ser pescado rojo, blanco, sardinas y camarones, este producto lo vende en diferentes aldeas.
Don Rosa camina de casa en casa vendiendo y es así como a obtenido mucha clientela, su venta las realiza dos días a la semana y lo hace de manera ambulante.
Don Rosa está solicitando el préstamo para compra  de  pescado rojo, blanco, sardinas, camarones, etc. Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
Don Rosa su sueño es tener un negocio  establecido en su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril de 2013
texts.en:
Señor Rosa is 34 years old. He lives with his wife in their house. He has worked in his business, which is selling seafood, for 10 years. He now buys seafood, such as red fish, white fish, sardines, and shrimp. He sells these products in different villages. He walks from house to house selling, and in this way he has obtained many customers. He makes his sales two days a week as a street vendor.

Don Rosa is applying for a loan to purchase red fish, white fish, sardines, shrimp, etc. With the earnings and the support of this loan, he wants to advance and continue improving his income.

Don Rosa's dream is to have an established business in his own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -- April, 2013

loans.use: to buy red fish, white fish, sardines, shrimp, etc. for his business

loans.name: Umoja Kigogo Group

texts.en: Ester, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who go to school. She has been running a business selling bathing soap from outside the country for five years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Ester's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her soap stock by buying more boxes whenever she received a loan. She used the profit to buy a mattress and another bed. She also bought bricks and managed to pay off her plot. She will use this loan to add more products to her business, such as washing soap, mopping soap and more boxes of bathing soap. Her dream is to one day own a supermarket. Ester will share this loan with her group, Umoja Kigogo, consisting of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to add more products to her business, such as washing soap, mopping soap and more boxes of bathing soap.

loans.name: Atika

texts.en: Atika is a 31-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3-children. Her husband's salary is not enough to meet the household needs. Therefore, Atika has been running a small business to help her husband to generate some income. She purchases new shawls for reselling them at a profitable price. She is a very hardworking woman. The variety of shawls she sells, are liked by everyone. Currently the stock of her shawls is almost finished, therefore, she is interested in purchasing a variety of products in different colors for her business. For that purpose she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help her to increase her net income and savings for the future. She will use the profit amount for the education of her children. She is feeling very confident and satisfied after taking this loan because this amount will help her to manage the household expenses and to meet her children's education expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of shawls for resale

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en:
Aneela is a 22-year-old young and energetic women. She is educated and a well-mannered, responsible mother of one chiild. Her husband is working in a government organization. For a better future for her son she has been doing a part time business of selling ladies shoes from her house.

Aneela has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to open a shop in the market to run her business properly as she is not getting enough customers in her house. She would purchase a new variety of shoes and in this way she could expand her business.  With the profit amount she would send her son to the best school in town.  She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of shoes

loans.name: Husan's Group

texts.en:
Husan is a 52-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and 6 children. Her husband has been running a business of gem stones from 20 years. He has a shop in the main market of the city. As a member of a two person group, Husan has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the loan amount her husband wants to purchase a new variety of rare gem stones. This would attract more customers and his sales would be increased. After getting the profit Husan would pay the installments of the loan and save some money for the marriage of her children. 

NOTE: In the picture husan is raising her hand

loans.use: to purchase a variety of gem stones

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a fisherman from the town of CPG, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of three children. Walter has been in the business for more than 7 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Walter is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. Through this, he will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Josbel

texts.en:
Josbel is a 41-year-old married woman from Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol and is a mother of five children. She earns a living through her sari-sari, or variety store, business selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Josbel is asking for a loan to buy more canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries. Through this loan, she will be able to improve the stock in her variety store and attract more buyers. In the future, Josbel dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Nageena

texts.en: Nageena is a 35-year-old married women who lives with her husband and a daughter in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her biggest dream in life is to marry her daughter into a good and respectable family. For 10 years, Nageena's husband has been driving a taxi, which is the only source of income for his family. But for the last 20 days he has not been able to generate any income as his taxi stopped working and needs to be repaired. Nageena has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to repair her husband's taxi so that he can continue his work. This will not only improve the taxi's condition but will help in improving the family's income as well

loans.use: to meet the repairing cost of her husband's taxi

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is a 53-year-old vegetable farmer from the province of Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man and the father of eight children.

Pablo is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. With these items, he will be able to improve his farm and increase his harvest. In the future, Pablo hopes of making his farm a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and the mother of five grown children. Teresita has been in the farming business for over 20 years now.
 
Teresita is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. With these items she will be able to improve her farm and her harvest. In the future Teresita hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Lory Joy

texts.en:
Lory Joy is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She has been a vegetable gardener for over two years now. This is the source of her income.

Lory Joy is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this loan she will be able to improve her farm and her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. Pedrito has been in the business for over 10 years now. This is the source of his income.

Pedrito is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. Through this loan, he will be able to improve his farm and his harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Tito

texts.en: Tito is a vegetable farmer from Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man and has four children. Tito is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, he will be able to improve his farm as well as his harvest. In the future, Tito hopes of making his business a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make the concrete slab for the patio in front of his house.

loans.name: Mabel's Group

texts.en:
Diana is 42 years old and married. She has a third grade education and two children who are in school. She buys glasses and plates from the market and sell them to customers. She started this business with a little capital and so far has seven years' experience. She has the support of her husband, who is a driver.

Diana has organized these women to ask for a loan. She needs to buy two boxes of plates and glasses each to sell to customers. In the future, she wants her business to prosper and hopes to own a supply joint. The other members of the group work in provisions and cosmetics. They need a total amount of 2,150 cedis to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of plates and glasses each to sell to customers.

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik is 48 years old. He was born, and lives with his wife and three children, in the city of Vedi in the Ararat region of Armenia. Norik is a graduate of Ararat State Industrial and Accounting College. Until the Soviet Union collapsed, Norik worked as an accountant. After the Soviet Union collapsed, he moved to Russia to work abroad.
 
Now Norik and his family are engaged in the agriculture business. He has a large plot of land where he performs his land cultivation. Norik grows potatoes, tomatoes, cucumber and many other vegetables and sells them in to Yerevan fruit and vegetable markets. Norik also has a big barn for animals where he breeds cows and sheep. The profit from animal breeding and land cultivating allows him to sustain his big family and pay for his children's education. He is very happy that he lives and operates in his motherland with his big family. 

Norik decided to enlarge his animal breeding business and would like a loan from Kiva lenders to buy two young calves and repair the animal barn.

loans.use: to buy two young calves and repair the animal barn.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila is a widow. She lives in a small private apartment. Recently she improved her living conditions - put new floors, wallpaper, kitchen tiles, etc. Now Ludmila is asking for a loan to put new windows.  That will help her to save some home energy. Ludmila has one daughter who helps her to maintain her household.

loans.use: to purchase new windows for her apartment

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy a variety of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Then

texts.en: Then is requesting a new loan to buy a variety of new products, such as rice, sugar and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice and beverages to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of products such as basic foods: rice, milk, sugar, and beverages to sell from her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as basic foods: rice, milk, sugar, and beverages to sell in her general store

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le, 53 years old, is a widow and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Le has been running a general store in her community for 11 years. 

To better satisfy her customers, she is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of products to stock in her store, such as sugar, milk and seasoning powder.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate greater income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of products to stock in her store, such as sugar, milk, and seasoning powder

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her four children. She loves her family and claims they are her greatest strength and reason for getting up each morning and working hard to generate an income. 

Since 2003, Riffat has been working as a tailor. She provides stitching services in her community. Her eldest daughter also helps her in stitching up dresses. She has excellent stitching skills and, with the money she generates, she has managed to provide a better quality of life for her family. Her greatest wish is to expand her business and to purchase one more sewing machine, as the number of her customers is increasing day by day. However, with only one machine, she cannot easily cope with all her customers on time, and that results in a loss of money and customers.

Therefore, Riffat is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to invest in the purchase of a sewing machine, which will allow her to fulfill the demands of customers more efficiently and to elevate her level of income. With her profit, she will pay the educational expenses of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for stitching dresses

loans.name: Nhip

texts.en: Nhip would like to take a further loan to buy a larger quantity and variety of fruits and vegetables to sell in her store. Nhip's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn greater income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity and variety of fruits and vegetables to stock her store.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en: Duyen is requesting a new loan to buy more furniture and high quality food to serve to her customers. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increase sales while also helping her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture and high quality food to serve to her customers.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung is requesting a new loan to buy a variety of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a varitey of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy more furniture and good quality food to serve her customers. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture and good quality food to serve her customers

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan, 33, is married and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband started a business of selling medicine 2 years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of medicines to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of medicines to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung, 33, is single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a beauty shop for 5 years.
She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a new shampoo chair to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new shampoo chair to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 44, is married and has four sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a auto mechanic. Loan has been selling pork pies and salted shredded meat to people in her community for 5 years. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of pork pies and salted shredded meat to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of pork pies and salted shredded meat to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en: Ngan is a 47-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Ngan has been running a business of selling clothes, which she has done for three years. Ngan would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to serve her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income, which in turn will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes.

loans.name: Nghin

texts.en:
Nghin is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two sons in Ho Chi Minh City. She started selling clothes five years ago in order to help support the family.

Nghin is applying for a 20,000,000 VND loan through CEP to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to sell to her customers. She hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 49, is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a mason.

For the past six years Yen has run a business selling clothes. She is requesting a 20,000,000 VND loan through CEP to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hermis

texts.es:
La Joven Hermis, de  23 años, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad  de Nacaome, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 2  años a la venta de arroz, frijoles, huevos, espaguetis, pollo, carne, chuleta,  manteca, etc.
Hermis su negocio está ubicado en su casa, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan de lunes a domingo y sus ventas son muy buenas.
Hermis está solicitando el préstamo para compra de más productos para su pulpería, como arroz, frijoles, huevos, pollo, carne, salsas, pastas, pan, refrescos, jugos, leches etc.   Y  así poder obtener más ganancias en su negocio 
Hermis su sueño es ampliar más grande su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013.
texts.en:
Hermis is 32 years old and lives in a home of her own in Nacaome, in the southern zone of Honduras.  She has been selling rice, beans, eggs, spaghetti, chicken, meat, chops, lard, etc. for two years.

Hermis’ business is in her home and her customers are her friends and neighbors who visit her from Monday through Sunday.  Her sales are very good.

Hermis is asking for a loan to buy products for her grocery store, such as rice, beans, eggs, chicken, meat, salsa, pasta, bread, soft drinks, juices, milk, etc. and be able to earn more in her business.

Hermis’ dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is married to a farmer and has an eight-year-old son. She is from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol.

For five years now Zenaida has worked hard in a mat weaving business. She is applying for a loan of 15,000 PHP through CEVI to buy materials like ink and fronds from the buri palm to increase her production.

In the future Zenaida hopes to buy a hog for a celebration feast and continue investing in her business for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy ink and fronds from the buri palm.

loans.name: Jeanna

texts.en:
Jeanna is 59 years old and comes from the community of Ubay, Bohol. She has been rice farming for five years now, together with her husband. They work hard on the farm to earn a living and produce a better crop every four months. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and quality seedlings so she can work on the field without having to worry about the needed capital.

Their produce will be their source of food consumption and an income as well. She is optimistic that with the help of the loan, she can continue making her business a success and be assured of a good yield.

In the future, she hopes to continue working and save so she can live in comfort in her golden years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Neria

texts.en:
Neria is 39 years old and comes from the town of Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She is married with four children aged between 6 and 19 years old. Her husband is a fisherman. Neria has been weaving mats for a living for six years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy burri and ink to color the mats. The loan will serve as additional capital so that she can continue her business and increase her production. Her business helps Neria and her husband with raising their family. Any income will be for her family's consumption and school fees. Her children's education is her priority.

In the future, she hopes to see her children be successful in their lives and have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy burri and ink for mat weaving.

loans.name: Chitsaka

texts.en:
Chitsaka lives in a small town outside of Sagalato, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passionfruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers  in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Chitsaka has three children, and has been farming for eight years. She is currently tending to an orange orchard on her land. She is excited to start beekeeping because she sees it as a good source of income, and is looking forward to working with Honey Care because they give very good training.

Chitsaka has created a kindergarten program in her community, and volunteers her time to help teach and care for her pupils. With the income generated from her beehives, Chitsaka plans to sponsor kindergarten pupils, and pay the expenses for those children whose families cannot afford to front the minimal fees needed to buy teaching materials for the young girls and boys. Chitsaka's class is currently taught out of a small room with an unfinished roof, but her hope for the future is to save up enough money to build a proper classroom, so that her pupils have a good space to play and learn.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Nzuki

texts.en:
Nzuki lives in a small town outside of Magodi, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passionfruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Nzuki is married, and has seven children. His wife is retired, while he tends to their land. He has been farming for fifty-two years, and is currently tending to an orange orchard. He is looking forward to working with Honey Care because they give “personalized service” to his beehives, and the bees will help pollinate his crops.

This is Nzuki’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his beehives to start a tree plantation on his land. In the future, Nzuki hopes to continue farming, and start introducing new commercial crops.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives outside Magodi, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Rose has four children, and is currently growing cashew nuts on her land. She is excited to start working with Honey Care because they give “good advice on beekeeping,” and she is also looking forward to having her bees pollinate her crops. 

This is Rose’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated from her beehives to make some improvements and investments around her farm. In the future, Rose hopes to save up enough money to build a chicken house for her poultry.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 21 years old, and is married with a 1-year-old son. She is from Alicia, Bohol. Jennifer farms rice for a living to support her young family. She started this business two years ago to help her husband. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her crops.  

Jennifer knows that with fertilizer, she can be assured of a better yield on her farm. Her income will be for the family's daily consumption and household bills. She hopes that someday she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Musyoka

texts.en:
Musyoka lives in a small town outside of Magodi, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult, and contribute to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food, from wild mangrove forest and local passionfruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives. 

Musyoka is married, and has four children. Both he and his wife are farmers, and are currently tending to an orange orchard on their land. Musyoka is excited to work with Honey Care because their Hive Technicians give dedicated service to the beehives, and he is looking forward to improved crop production from his bees’ pollination. 

This is Musyoka’s first loan, and he plans to use the income to start a project rearing indigenous chickens, which are more hardy and resilient than imported breeds of chickens. In the future, Musyoka hopes to save up enough money to make improvements to his family home.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Rosila

texts.en:
Rosila is a 40-year-old farmer from the community of Ubay, Bohol. She is married with seven children aged between 8 and 21 years old.

Rosila has grown rice for 20 years now, to support the needs of her family. She is requesting for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, seedlings and insecticide. These inputs will help assure Rosila that she can have a better harvest in the next four months. With her farm being taken care of, she can be hopeful that she can continue to support her children's needs, especially their education. 

In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her farm in order to earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and insecticide.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in a small town outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Elizabeth has been farming for three years, and is currently growing maize and beans on a small plot of land. She is interested in beekeeping because it is a long-term project that requires little investment and can provide good income. 

This is Elizabeth’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated from her beehives to help her start a small business. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to own enough of her own land to provide for herself.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Dorsina

texts.en:
Dorsina lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Dorsina is married, and has twelve children. Both her and her husband have been farming for thirty-five years, and are currently growing maize, beans and vegetables on their land. Dorsina likes beekeeping because it is not a time consuming activity, and it allows her to focus on her farming. 
	
This is Dorsina’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated from her beehives to pay school fees for her grandchildren. In the future, Dorsina hopes to invest more in her farm, and to see her grandchildren through school “so they can have good jobs.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse lives in a small village outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Jesse is married, and has twelve children. Both he and his wife have been farming for thirty-five years, and are currently growing maize, beans and vegetables on their land. Jesse likes beekeeping because “it doesn’t require hard work.”

This is Jesse’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his beehives to take care of his grandchildren and pay people to help him farm. Jesse’s hope for the future is to see his grandchildren grow up well, and live happy lives.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Faith is married, and has three children. Both her and her husband are farmers, and are currently growing bananas, maize and vegetables on their land. Faith is looking forward to starting to keep bees because it is a long-term project that is easy to manage. 

This is Faith's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated from her hives to buy even more beehives, so she can earn enough to pay college fees for her children. Faith's hope for the future is to see her children through school, so that they can live a good life.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Yaritza Yunieth

texts.es: Yaritza Yunieth casada con un hijo menor de edad, del domicilio de Chinandega, zona que se ha caracterizado por ser productiva en el comercio, Yaritza es una microempresaria la cual posee en su casa de habitación una pulpería que consisten en vender productos de consumo diario del hogar en cantidades pequeñas como una bolsita de café, bolsita de champo, bolsita de detergente un jabón de lavar ropa, pasta dental, una libra de arroz, ¼ de aceite productos congelados, golosinas, leña entre otros más, ella inicia este negocio con fondos propios para ayudar con los gastos en el hogar,  uno de sus sueños es incrementar mas su negocio, El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y en un futuro cercano aumentar sus ingresos
texts.en: Yaritza Yunieth is married with one child who is a minor. She lives in Chinandega, an area characterized for its productive trade. Yaritza is a micro-business woman who has her business of a small grocery store in her home. The business consists of selling everyday home products in small sizes, like little bags of coffee, of shampoo, of laundry detergent, and toothpaste, a pound of rice, 1/4 of oil, frozen goods, sweets and wool among other products. She started this business with her own funds to help with the household expenses. One of her dreams is to grow her business more. The aim of the loan is to invest it in her working capital, stock her grocery store, provide her customers with a better service and increase her income in the near future.

loans.use: to have working capital to purchase basic products like beans, sugar, rice, oil, sweets and dairy products among other items.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Annah has six children, and has been farming for thirty years. She is currently growing maize and bananas on her land, and has a small plot of vegetables that she uses to cook with. Annah is excited to start beekeeping because "it is a long term project that will help me take care of my family, plus I only need to buy a hive and the bees will do the rest of the work."

This is Annah's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to buy food for her family, and pay the school fees of her grandchildren. Annah's hope for the future is "to see my grandchildren live a better life than what I am giving them."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat lives outside of Butere, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Josphat is married, and has one child. His wife works as a teacher, while Josphat farms their land. He has been farming for three years, and is currently growing potatoes and vegetables. He is excited to start working with Honey Care because they do their inspections in an “orderly way.” He was also interested in becoming a beekeeper because the area where he lives is full of good forage for bees. 

This is Josphat's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his beehives to buy even more beehives. In the future, Josphat hopes to "live a stress-free life while enjoying what I would have earned through farming."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Sakhr

texts.en:
Sakhr is a 29-year-old, married man with one child. He lives in Ibb, Yemen. 

Sakhr has been running a business selling womens' accessories for many years. His business is located in a market. Because of his good customer skills, he is able to attract more clients. He would like to expand his business, so he applied for a youth loan of 160,000 YER. He will use the loan to purchase additional womens' accessories and materials to re-sell. He loves his work and he really prefers to work with these types of products. He thanks Kiva lenders for financing his first loan.

loans.use: to buy additional womens' accessories and materials to sell.

loans.name: Al-Bathor Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Bathor. It consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The members of group are very trustworthy, responsible, and hard-working. They have all known each other for a long time and they know each other well. The group has taken a loan of 120,000 YER.

Abeer is a 31-year-old married woman and has four children. She has been operating a business selling clothing, perfume, and incense for four years. She started her business to assist her husband to continue providing her childrens' expenses. She requested a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB which she will use to buy clothes, incense and perfumes so that she can provide her customers with a wider selection and better quality products.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, incense and perfumes to re-sell.

loans.name: Reef Group

texts.en:
This group, called Reef, consists of four female members. They are from Hodeida, Yemen and they know each other very well. All the group members are considered hardworking people who very much want to get ahead. This group took a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. 

Lamia is a 24-year-old married woman who is happy to be a part of this group. She has been distributing ladies and childrens' clothes, perfumes and incense. She started the business with a small amount to earn more profits. She loves her work and hopes to continue. Her portion of this group loan is 50,000 YER, which she will use to continue buying childrens' and ladies' clothes, perfumes and incense.

loans.use: to continue buying childrens' and ladies' clothes, perfumes and incense to re-sell.

loans.name: Shrooq Group

texts.en:
This group is called Shrooq. It consists of four members who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The members have developed business activities and applied for a loan of 100,000 YER. 

Elham is a 29-year-old married woman. She currently has a business drawing tattoos on ladies' hands. She learned the trade and has been in this line of work for many years; most of her customers are brides. She would like to expand her business, so she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to increase her capital, and buy pigment and henna materials to draw tattoos on ladies' hands. 

Working in this manner allows Elham to help her family move forward.

loans.use: to buy pigment and henna materials to draw tattoos on ladies' hands.

loans.name: Al-Fuad Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Fuad and consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Aisha is one of the many Yemeni women who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.
