She is 41 years old, and is married. She has five years experience with her home-based sewing and tailoring business, and has an established client base. 

Aisha is now trying to improve her business, and would like to focus on improving her own work experience. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a sewing machine for her business. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her home-based sewing and tailoring business.

loans.name: Ashraq Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ashraq and is made up of five women. They live in Taiz, Yemen, and have taken a loan of 300,000 YER. 

Mriam is a 33-yea- old married housewife with four children. The main hardship that she faces is a lack of money. So, she is requesting a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to purchase home appliances for her house. She is the leader of the group, and she hopes to offer her family a good life.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Nivin

texts.en:
Nivin has diversified into selling cosmetic supplies and jewelry. Her store is located near another hair salon and health center, garnering strong foot traffic and walk in customers to supplement her ongoing clients. Nivin and her husband work hard to create a loving environment for their family. They are determined for their children to become educated and have a bright future.

Nivin needed this loan to purchase a showcase window, an air conditioner and cosmetic supplies.

Nivin offers competitive prices and stocks a variety of cosmetics. She one day wants to specialize and become the sole supplier of certain brands.

loans.use: to purchase a showcase window, an air conditioner and cosmetic supplies.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона молодая нежамужняя девушка. Ей 20. Она проживает в районе Кумсангир вместе с родителями. У Фарзоны среднее образование. Она с 16 лет занимается растениеводством. У нее имеется небольшой участок земли, на котором она выращивает клубнику. Одновременно Фарзона еще и занимается животноводством. Она разводит овец. Фарзона занимается сельским хозяйством вот уже 4 года и научилась этому делу у своих родителей. Кредит запрашивает для приобретения минеральных удобрений для урожая клубники, а также закупа мелкорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Farzona is a young, unmarried woman.  She is 20 years old and lives with her parents in the Qumsangir region.  Farzona has a secondary level education.  Since she was 16, she has been in the business of crop farming.  She has a modest sized piece of land where she grows strawberries.  At the same time, she also raises sheep.  Farzona has been in the agriculture business for four years and learned this business from her parents.

Farzona is requesting this loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers for her strawberries, as well as to buy sheep and goats.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers as well as sheep and goats.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel 58 años de edad casada con cuatro hijos mayores de edad, originaria de unos de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en al norte del  occidente del país, Reyna se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal y laboral, ella posee un negocio de venta de productos de cosméticos y de perfumes, actividad que la ejerce de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación, con los prestamos obtenidos ha logrado incrementar mas su negocio, ahora con el invierno puesto en puerta, ella esta solicitando financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda ya que esta necesita reparación de techo y una parte de la pared, el objetivo del crédito es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento,  zinc, perlines, hierro, arena, clavos, cal, piedrín, entre otros. Reyna agradece el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas brindan a las personas de bajos recursos económicos para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en: Reyna Isbel is 58 years old, married, and has for grown children. She is originally from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, which is located in northwest of the country. Reyna is a hardworking person, with a great desire to get ahead in her personal and work life. She sells cosmetic products and perfumes, which she does as a street seller and also from her house. With the loans she has obtained she has been able to grow her business. Now with winter coming up, she is requesting a loan to improve her house because it needs repairs to the roof and a part of the wall. The objective of the loan is to buy construction materials such as: cement, zinc roofing, c-beams, rebar, sand, nails, lime, and gravel, among other things. Reyna is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders provide to people of few resources so the can have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as: cement, zinc roofing, rebar, sand, nails, lime, and gravel, among other things.

loans.name: Hambardzum

texts.en:
Hambardzum is 55 years old and lives with his wife, son and daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren in the village of Zovaber, which is in Sevan area. His wife and son are engaged in farming. They breeds cows, sheep chicken, piglets in their animal barn. 

For a long time, Hambardzum worked as a driver in Sevan city. Since 2010, Hambardzum has run his own business. He built a small store near his house and sells household goods and food which he buys from Yerevan wholesale market. From time to time his son helps him in the business and transports the goods from Yerevan. 

Hambardzum said his family is large and they have to work hard day and night in order to sustain their big family. At the same time, Hambardzum is very appreciative and happy that his business income allows him to meet his family's needs and to not move abroad to work, which is very common in their region. 

Hambardzum needs a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy lots of food and household goods from the Yerevan wholesale markets, and to repair the roof of his store. This is his first time Kiva, and he hopes that it will be good for him.

loans.use: to buy lots of food and household goods from the Yerevan wholesale markets to sell in his store, and to repair the roof of his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, purchase stock and pay for renovations to the changing room of her clothing store.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is 43 years old and lives with her husband in the village of Geghamavan, which is in Sevan area. Gohar has a son, who is now in his military service in the Armenian Army, and a daughter who is married and lives with her own family, separately from her parents. 

Gohar’s husband is policeman and works in the Sevan police agency. Gohar is an accountant, but she has never worked in her profession. After getting married, Gohar and her husband started an agricultural business. They have a plot of land near their house and grows vegetables which Gohar sells in the Sevan fruit markets. Gohar also has a large barn for animals where she breeds cows, sheep and pigs. 

Gohar is a very hardworking person and she likes her agricultural occupation. With the profits from her farming, Gohar meets her family's needs and from time to time she helps her daughter’s newly created family. 

Gohar is very happy and decided to increase her animal breeding. For this she needs a loan to buy three young calves and fodder for her animals. She hopes to receive more profits from animal breeding in future. This is Gohar's first loan with Kiva, and she hopes that the Kiva loan will bring success to her agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy three young calves and fodder for her animals, so that she can increase her animal breeding activities.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto 24 años de edad soltero, es originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, el es un hombre trabajador, responsable que ha logrado poder terminar sus estudios de secundaria, ya que desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar y estudiar a la misma vez, uno de sus sueños es ser una persona profesional y asi poder tener algo que ofrecer un buen futuro cuando forme una familia, el cuenta con el salario de su trabajo donde labora como cobrador, Jorge solicita financiamiento para realizar mejoras en la propiedad de su mama que es donde habita, e uno de sus sueños es poder en un futuro comprar su propia casa, el objetivo del crédito es para invertir en materiales de  construcción  para dos cuartos como: zin, madera, playvood, gypsien, clavos, arena, cemento, entre otros
texts.en: Jorge Alberto is 24 years old, single and originally from the town of Chinandega, which is in the west of the county.  He is hard-working and responsible and managed to complete secondary school, though he had to start work from a young age and study at the same time.  One of Jorge's biggest dreams is to become a professional so as to be able to offer the family that he hopes to have a good future.  Jorge earns a living as a bus conductor but is applying for a loan in order to make some improvements to his mother's house, which is where hr lives.  Jorge one day wants to buy his own home.  This loan will be used to buy building materials for two rooms, such as zinc, wood, plywood, nails, sand, cement and more.

loans.use: to buy building material such as zinc, sand, wood, lime and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do work on one room in his home.

loans.name: Colores. Group

texts.es: Colores es un grupo solidario que tiene 4 ciclos con su crédito. Carmela es una de las mujeres que componen el grupo, tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 7 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, dulcería, papelería y paletería, tiene 2 años aproximadamente con su negocio, y el crédito lo usará para comprar una parrilla grande y comenzar con la venta de pollo y hamburguesas en las noches, los fines de semana. Carmela se siente muy a gusto con su grupo y las conoce muy bien a todas.
texts.en: "Colores" is a group which is now on its fourth loan cycle.  Carmela is one member of the group. She is 37 years old, married and has two children, aged 11 and 7 years old.  She makes a living selling groceries, sweets, stationery and ice creams.  She has had the business for around ten years and she plans to use this loan to buy a large grill and start selling chicken and hamburgers in the evenings and at the weekend.  Carmela is very happy with his group and knows each member very well.

loans.use: to buy a large grill.

loans.name: Reyna Aquilina

texts.es: Reyna Aquilina mayor de edad soltera con dos hijos, aun menores de edad, del domicilio de unos de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado al sur del occidente del país, Reyna se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable que ha luchado sola para criar a sus hijos, ella en sus ratos libres le gusta mucho conversar con sus hijos saber más de ellos sus pensamientos cuáles son sus metas para seguir estudiando y que es lo que más le gusta a ellos, Reyna se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como: cosméticos, ropa de adultos, niño, chinería, prendas, zapatos, adornos entre otros más, sus compras las realiza en casas de distribuidores y en Managua vende en distintos centros de trabajos y comerciantes ambulante tiene clientes fijos y eventuales da al crédito y al contado ella recupera semanal o quincenal, ella vende de manera ambulante y en su casa de habitación, el objetivo del crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo, en la compra de productos como: cosméticos, zapatos, diversidad de ropa, prendas de oro, plata, cremas, tratamientos entre otros. Reyna esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les brindan a las personas de bajos recursos economicos.
texts.en: Reyna Aquilina is single and has two children who are still young. She lives in one of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the southwest of the country. Reyna is an entrepreneurial and responsible woman who has worked hard by herself to raise her children. In her free time she likes to talk with her children to learn more about their thoughts and their goals to continue studying, and what are their favorite things. Reyna sells general merchandise, such as cosmetics, clothing for adults and children, dishes, jewelry, shoes, decorative items, and other things. She buys her products from distributors in Managua. She sells in certain work places and also works as a street vendor. She has regular clients and also occasional customers. She sells on credit and for cash. She charges people weekly or bi-weekly. The goal of the loan is to have working capital. She will buy products such as cosmetic, shoes, a variety of clothing, gold and silver jewelry, lotions, and medicines, among other items. Reyna is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders provide to people of few economic resources.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic, shoes, a variety of clothing, gold and silver jewelry, lotions, and medicines, among other items

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a 41-year-old man from Gicumbi District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of 60,000 Rwandan francs (RWF) to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Innocent started selling lights in December, 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en: Huon, a mother of six children, is a local villager from the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province where rice farming is the common business among her neighborhood. No different from other villagers, Huon also grows rice on two hectares of land and plants peanuts for extra income. For the 20 years she has been engaged in her current business, she is able to earn up to 34,400 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Houn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful past loans that she has fully repaid, she feels confident that she can sustain her business at a gradual pace. For this cycle, she is seeking 3,000,000 KHR in order to buy seven sacks of potash, to pay the plowing fee, and to buy a good peanut seed for growing. She hopes that this purchase will support her business on time and return her triple income so that she can expand her cash-crop plantation on time

loans.use: To buy seven sacks of potash, to pay the plowing fee, and to buy a good peanut seed for growing

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander Antonio, 25 años de edad casado con un hijo menor de edad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega el cual está ubicado al norte del occidente del  país  y se caracteriza por ser un zona comercial productiva, en diversos sectores de comercio, Alexander cuenta con su salario por sus servicios profesionales como  docente  de primaria en una de las comarcas de este municipio, el está solicitando este crédito para continuar haciendo mejoras en su hogar ya que se aproximan las lluvias y desea brindarles una mejor seguridad a su pequeño hijo y esposa, el objetivo del crédito es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, arena, mano de obra, cal, entre otros.-
texts.en: Alexander Antonio, 25, is married and has a little boy.  He is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega which is in the northern part of the country and known as a productive commercial area in its different trade sectors.  Alexander earns a salary working as a primary school teacher in one of the town counties.  He is requesting a loan to continue renovating his house because of the upcoming rainy season.  He wants to give his small son and wife more safety.  The loan will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, lime and to hire workers.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as cement, lime, sand and to hire workers.

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en: Originally from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Sin is a local farmer who does rice cultivation as her primary source of income and supplements the family’s income with a pig-raising business. From the current business, she is able to earn up to 23,500 KHR per day. Including this loan, Sin is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s parter). She has fully repaid her past loan, which enables her to run both businesses smoothly. Now, she formed a group of two to apply for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to lease an additional plot of farmland to grow rice. She hopes to increase her income and make a good profit to sustain her good living conditions.

loans.use: To lease an additional plot of farmland to grow rice

loans.name: Yeoung's Group

texts.en: Yeoung, 52, is a widowed mother of five kids residing in Kampong Cham. To sustain her family as a single mother, she does rice cropping on one hectare of farmland. It is the business that she has had for 30 years and it returns her about 38,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Yeoung’s group of seven members. Out of the seven members, only one co-borrower is seeking 500,000 KHR. The rest of the members, including Yeoung, are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fragrant rice seed and potash for replanting. She hopes that this purchase will support her cash-crop farming on time and get back to her a good yield with better profit so that she can improve her living conditions and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fragrant rice seed and potash for replanting

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de jora que se usa para preparar chicha que es un bebida a base de maiz,la socia tambien trabaja en su salon de belleza,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar sus negocios de venta de jora y salon de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ruleros,tintes y tijeras para implementar su salon de belleza.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues with her business of selling jora, which is a corn-based product used for a preparation of chicha (a traditional corn-based drink). She also works in her beauty salon. By means of these activities, Gladis is able to provide for her children. She would like to improve both her beauty salon business and her jora sales. She is seeking a loan to buy curlers, hair color and scissors for her salon.

She is happy about the loan and committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy curlers, hair color, and scissors for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al ngeocio de venta de comida,la socia prepara sopas,pollo con papas y saltado de carne,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicito el credito para comprar arroz,pollo,carne y verduras.

La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
The borrower continues with her business selling food.  She makes soups, chicken and potatoes and sauteed meat, and works from 8:00 a.m to 6:00 p.m.  For seven years she has been in business and it is going well for her.  Her goal is to have a restaurant one day.  She is requesting the loan to buy rice, chicken, meat and vegetables.

The borrower is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue with her business so she can support her household.

loans.use: To buy rice, chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik is an engineer with work experience as a senior engineer. He is 58 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in the village of Varser, which is in the Sevan area. His wife is a famous teacher in Sevan but she is not working nowadays.  

Rafik used to work as an engineer in different factories in Armenia and Russia, but after the Soviet Union collapse he became jobless and started his agricultural business. His wife engages in land cultivation and grows vegetables and fruits, which Rafik sells in Sevan markets. For more than 20 years Rafik has engaged in the agricultural business. He breeds geese on his farm and confesses that his knowledge in engineering helped him to discover the secrets of poultry. He has more than 50 geese and takes care of them with great pleasure, and says he said he must be very patient and kind in order to understand the complexities of taking care of birds. 

Rafik asks for a loan from Kiva lenders to repair the barn of his geese and to add the number of his birds on his farm.

loans.use: to repair the barn of his geese and to add to the number of birds on his farm.

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
36-year-old driver Sasun lives with his wife and daughter in the village of Tsovagyugh, which is in the Sevan area. After getting married, Sasun started to work as a driver in Sevan city, but his main source of income comes from his agricultural business. Since childhood, Sasun has been engaged in farming. Now his wife helps him on the farm. They breed cows and sheep in the barn for animals, which they have built near their house. The milk from the farm Sasun provides to one of the biggest companies that produces dairy products and the meat from farming Sasun sells to a Sevan foods market. At the same time, his wife grows vegetables and fruits in their garden, which brings them additional income. Sasun is very pleased with his agricultural business, which allows him to sustain his family's needs and pay for his daughter education.
 
Because of the higher demand for milk in his region, Sasun decided to increase his number of animals and ask for a loan from Kiva to buy some calves and fodder for his animals. This is the first loan from Nor Horizon and from Kiva for Sasun and he hopes that this cooperation will be successful for him and that he will receive a good profit after this deal.

loans.use: To buy some calves and fodder for his animals

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de maiz y crianza de animales como chanchos y cuyes,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia tambien el maiz lo vende en las ferias,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar sus pequeños negocios.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y chanchos.

a socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The borrower continues with her businesses selling corn and raising animals such as pigs and guinea pigs.  She fattens the animals until they are grown and then sells them at different markets.  She also sells corn at the markets.  She has been in business for seven years and it is going well.  Her goal is to expand both her small businesses.  The loan she is requesting is to buy pigs and guinea pigs.

The borrower is very grateful for this opportunity and is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Justina, ella pertenece al banco “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de 
Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. 

La socia sigue con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y cerdos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia a la vez continua dedicandose a su negocio de venta de leña y venta de piedras las cuales extrae de una cantera que posee en su terreno. la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia Justina solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

La socia Justina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecer su comercio el cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
The borrower, Justina, belongs to the communal bank Las Triunfadoras located in the district of Andahuaylillas in the province of Quispicanchis in Cusco, Peru. 

She continues with her business of breeding small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  She has been in business for quite some time and it is going well because of the hard work she puts into it every day.  She also continues selling firewood and stones from a quarry on her land.  Justina wants to continue working so she can support her family.

Justina is now asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. 

She is very grateful to Kiva for permitting her to strengthen her business which allows her to sustain her home.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Selta

texts.en:
Selta lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is an area with high poultry production and consumption. She has nine children and has been doing this work for 31 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Feeding cows." Her biggest challenge is "diseases." Animals on the farm have been given the names of Maua and Ndume.

Selta was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Juhudi Kilimo offers loans to farmers at a lower interest rate." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Importance of saving money."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, "How will this loan benefit her family" Selta replied, "She will be able to educate my child."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Selta owns the following: cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dip freezer for cooling of his soft drinks and to buy additional soft drinks for his bar.

loans.name: Shelk  M.

texts.en:
Please meet 35-year-old Shelk M. from Gbarnga, in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the center of Liberia, in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers, cultivating crops, such as rice, palm oil, and cassava.   

Shelk M. completed 12 grades of school and he is married. His wife is a palm oil-seller. He has two children, aged ten and six. They are in school and they all live at home. 

Shelk M. has a gas station. He has been in business for three years and he works 14 hours per day at his business, from Monday to Saturday. With this loan, he will buy more gasoline. Two of the greatest challenges that he faces are a shortage of gasoline and transportation costs. Shelk M. transports his gasoline by tanker.  

He started his business by working for his father. Shelk M. is proud of his business because he has his own money and gains respect among his friends. His plan is to build a modern gas station. He thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell at his gas station.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 23-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is single and has three children, between 7 and 2. They are currently attending school and live at home. She has completed 7th grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.

She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Josephine has had a table business where she has sold dry and fresh fish for the past three years. She works from 7AM to 6PM every day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is less income. She intends to use the loan to buy more fish. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day to own a house.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Please meet 31-year-old Esther from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

She did not go to school and is married. She describes herself as a hard working woman. Her spouse works as a security man. They have four children between 4 and 15 years old, but only two are in school and live at home.
 
Esther has a shop to sell used clothes.  She has been in business for 6 years and works from Monday to Saturday, spending 10 hours per day.  With this loan, she will buy inventory.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is increasing her sales.  She transports her goods by taxi.  She started her business with money from her husband.  She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house.  She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a 36-year-old married man with four children. He describes himself as a talented father. His loan will be used to buy tanks to harvest rain water. This is his second loan through SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 60,000 was paid successfully. One of the challenges faced in the area Thika is inadequate water supply. The loan will help ensure all his children graduate from school. He is applying for a loan of KES 32,700 to clear the project.

loans.use: to buy tanks to harvest rain water.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman age 38. She has two children. She operates a farm business where she sells farm produce to earn an income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient clean water. She will use the KES 41,500 loan to buy a water tank. She is focused.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Shamuuni

texts.en:
Shamuuni is a married man who has two children aged 6 and 12 years. He describes himself as optimistic.
Shamuuni operates a store where he sells water and furniture and he has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 
Shamuuni will use the 55,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to purchase iron sheets and a water tank, and his business goal is to construct another house within five years. This is Shamuuni's second loan with SMEP DTM after his previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets and a water tank.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a 32 year old married man. He has 4 children aged from 1 to 6 years. He describes himself as being committed. He operates a transportation business  where he transports customers using a bicycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an urban area. 

Kennedy will use his KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of clothes for selling. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes for selling

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is grateful to Milango because of the impact of capital previously injected into her business. She was able to set up a charcoal selling shop. Due to increased clientele, Rehema is applying for a loan of 42,700 Kenya shillings to buy food stock for the cafe and also a new stock of charcoal. She believes the businesses will be able to cover the required repayments besides helping her pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy food stock for the cafe and also a new stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is the married father of two children. He owns a food stall, which he has been operating for three years. He mainly sells buns in this business.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and the effect of season changes. 

Elias is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy food items, such as wheat flour, cooking fat, etc. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay the school fees for his child and improve his living standards. His dream is to open another food cafe.

loans.use: to buy food items, such as wheat flour, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
A $1,500 loan is offered to Joana to improve her business. She will use this loan to stock up on items to sell in her store such as oil, slippers, detergent, soap, and rice. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.   

Joana lives in a town with her family. She opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own working. Joana is generating a good income from selling.

loans.use: to buy items such as oil, slippers, detergent, soap, and rice for resale

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is apply for a $1,000 loan to improve her business. She is married and she has one child.  She is using this loan to buy short pants, T-shirts, skirts, jeans and shirts. She has been her self in the business since 2008 with her own working capital of $200.00 and she is very happy with this loan because it helps to improve her business for the future.

loans.use: To buy pants, shorts and clothes

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is aged 45, married, and has been blessed with six school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry farming business, selling as retail and at the market to local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. He dream is to expand her business and to earn more income in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase chicken feed and chicks for her poultry business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 1 child . She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a retail shop where she sells flour, sugar, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more sugar, washing soap, flour and other items to sell in her shop. Her business goal is to have a big shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, washing soap, flour and other items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman and has three children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a video show business. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is power interruption in her place of operation.

With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to renovate her video room and purchase a television screen. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to renovate her video room and purchase a television screen.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married mother with five children who lives in the Nakuru area. She is applying for a Kes 15,000 loan that will be used to purchase extra seeds for her farming business. The profits made from the business will be used to purchase a dairy cow to enhance production of milk.

loans.use: To purchase extra seeds for her farming business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man with two children. He describes himself as an ambitious farmer. He is applying for a loan of 10,000 KES that he will use to purchase farm supplies for plowing his farm. He currently sells potatoes, maize and beans in his business. His major challenge is inadequate capital to invest in his business. This is his second successive loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for plowing his farm.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a 28-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as visionary. Elijah operates an auto spares shop where he sells motor vehicle spares. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are motor vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of capital for expansion. 

Elijah will use the KES 50,000 loan to to buy more auto spares to sell. His business goal is to start selling second-hand motorbikes within five years. He will use the profits to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more auto spares to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 46-year-old married man with 5 children. He describes himself as a flexible and optimistic father. He is applying for a loan of KES 10,000, which will be used to purchase clothes, buckets, basins and belts as stock. This is his 2nd loan application with SMEP DTM. The anticipated profits will be used to expand his business and also pay school fees for his children. This is his 8th year running the business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, buckets, basins and belts as stock.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 35-year-old man. He is married with four children. Peter describes himself as a focused businessman. 

He is applying for a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase another cow in order to boost milk production. Peter also runs a farming business where he plants potatoes and pyrethrum. This is Peter's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to boost milk production.

loans.name: Mikocheni Group

texts.en:
Halima, a member of the Mikocheni group, has been running two activities, charcoal selling and vitumbua (a kind of snack typically eaten at breakfast) for 15 years. She is a divorced woman in her mid 50's. She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily, and is able to make a fair return each month.

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania; it will be used to increase her charcoal stock. She dreams of buying some land.

She will share this loan with her loan group, " Mikocheni ", which has eleven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on her charcoal stock.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Manuela, ella pertenece al banco “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de 
Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú.

La socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y cerdos,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño quie le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia desea pode seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

La socia Manuela está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecer su comercio el cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
This member's name is Manuela. She belongs to the “Las Triunfadoras” bank from the district of Andahuaylillas, province of Quispicanchis of Cuzco – Peru.

She works raising small animals such as guinea pigs, chicken and pigs. She raises these animals to later sell them to the customers who order them. She has been doing this business for a long time and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She wants to keep working so she can support her family. She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

Manuela is very grateful to KIVA for allowing her to strengthen her business, which allows her to support her home.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Layee

texts.en:
Please meet 35-year-old Layee from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea. It is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Layee completed 12 grades and is married. His wife stays at home with their young child, who is 6 months old. He has one more child who is 12 years old and goes to school. They all live at home. 

Layee owns his own gasoline station and has been selling gasoline for the past three years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase petrol. On average, he works 15 hours a day. He started his business with money from his father. He transports his petrol by tanker. He cites the rainy season as his biggest challenge since he does not have a very good station. His favourite aspect of his business its location. In the future, he would like to build a house and rebuild his gas station.  

He thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to purchase petrol.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey operates a motor vehicle transport business in town. In addition he also operates motorcycle transport business, which earns him additional income. His major challenge is the high cost of purchasing fuel for his business. 

With the KES 50,000 he wants to add on his savings and purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to add to his savings and to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married, and has three children. She has owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a general store selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is seasonality.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a single mother of three children. She stays at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

For the past four months, she has operated a business selling fruit. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other fruit sellers. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruit at wholesale and to sell at a profit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit at wholesale to sell at a profit.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa, aged 45 years, is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over four years, she has operated a cloth selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mejumaa dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stock of second hand clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is from Voi.  She is married and has children who go to school and still depend on her.

Mwanaidi dedicates herself to selling construction materials.  She began this business activity by selling bricks.  In addition to the sale of construction materials,she does  a business of selling decorations and renting chairs and tables .  Thanks to the work she does, she is educating her children and getting ahead with the obligations. 

Mwanaidi is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials, with which she will be able to supply her business and continue working as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Eudocia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha de jora que es una bebida a base de maiz y tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas,la socia se dedica a estos negocios 5 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los animales.

La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
This member continues to work in her business selling chicha de jora, a corn based drink. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has worked at these businesses for 5 years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the animals. She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens as well as feed for the animals.

She is very grateful to KIVA for allowing her to continue with her economic activity and with her work to support her home.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens as well as feed for the animals.

loans.name: Chanra's Group

texts.en: Chanra, 53, is a rural villager from the Sangke district of Battambang province. To make a living, she is a vendor who sells shoes as her main source of income. Her husband works as a paid worker for extra money to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for five years. This is the fifth cycle for Chanra with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loans, which she has repaid completely, have supported her business in a good way and returned a decent income. Currently, she can earn up to 60,000 KHR per day. Now, she seeks a loan in the amount of 400,000 KHR, and her fellow group members request 1,000,000 KHR and 600,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more shoes to resell. She hopes to make more income and expand her business in scale and move to a big store.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Catalina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. 

La socia sigue dedicandose al negocio de venta de comida de forma ambulatoria.La socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia Catalina desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como arroz,aceite entre otros.

La socia Catalina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
This member's name is Catalina. She belongs to the “Las Triunfadoras” communal bank from the district of Andahuaylillas, province of Quispicanchis from Cuzco – Peru. 

She continues to work selling food as a street vendor. She has had her business for years and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. Catalina wants to keep keep working this way to keep supporting her family. She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients such as rice, oil and more. 

Catalina is very grateful to KIVA for allowing her to continue in her economic activity and with this work to support her home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, oil and more.

loans.name: Babi Rahayu Group

texts.en:
To continue their efforts and increase their number of pigs, the Babi Rahayu group took out the next loan with the same amount. These loans are used to purchase piglets, especially the superior species. The pig-breeding business can help increase their family income, because of easy maintenance and the fact that it can be used as additional work. Most of the members of the group work as farmers. Two of the members can’t attend the meeting because they have religious ceremony at the temple.

After success with selling piglets, now Ni Ketut prepare for another birth. She use the loan to purchase super quality feed and renovate the cage. She hope the piglets have a comfortable place and their growth can be more faster.

The group hopes this effort will be more advanced, they could save money and send their children to high levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feed and renovate the cage

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en: Florentino is 58 years of age and married with three children. He is into the farming business and has been doing this for already 30 years. With his desire to further improve his farming activities and produce more sacks of rice, he is requesting additional capital. He said that the 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan will be of help for him to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizers. Florentino is very positive the lenders will approve his loan request. His income in the business mostly supplements the educational expenditures of his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito is a fisherman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and has seven children who are still attending school. Julito has been in the fishing business for more than 25 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Julito is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. Through this, he will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty   est  une femme  mariée qui  vit  au  Sénégal. Elle  évolue  dans  le  secteur  du  commerce  depuis  5 ans. Son  activité  consiste  à  acheter  des  habits et  des  tissus  pour  les  revendre. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs au sein  du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou elle est membre.En plus des tissus qu'elle vend elle veut diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise en démarrant la vente de parfums. Avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices elle souhaite épargner de l’argent et contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Son projet futur est d’acquérir un magasin.
texts.en:
Maty is married and lives in Senegal. She has been actively involved in the trading sector for five years. Her business is buying clothes and fabrics for resale. 

She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs from the UIMCEC branch where she is a member. She would like to buy more fabrics and diversify the products she sells by buying perfumes. 

With the expected increase in profits, she hopes to save some money and contribution to the betterment of her family's living conditions. Her future project is to buy a store.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and perfumes for resale

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
La  Señora  Fidelia  46 años, vive con su hijo en su casa de habitación ubicada en un  Barrio de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 15  años a la venta comida como ser, carne asadas, papas fritas, refrescos, tajadas de plátanos etc. 
Doña Fidelia  su negocio lo tienen ubicado en un parque San Lorenzo, donde sus clientes son todas las personas que transitan a diario por ahí. 
Doña Fidelia  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mas productos para elaborar sus diferentes tipos de comidas, como plátanos, sal, cebollas, papas, salsas, carne de res, pollo, lechuga, remolachas, refrescos, etc.  ya que su clientela a aumentado y les están pidiendo  diversidad de platos de comida. 
Doña Fidelia con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende suplir su necesidad financiera. 
Doña Fidelia  su sueño poder estudiar a su hijo y comprarle una casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril  del 2013.
texts.en:
Fidelia is  46 years old and lives with her son in her home, located in the San Lorenzo neighborhood in the southern zone of Honduras.  She has been selling food, such as grilled meats, fried potatoes, soft drinks, sliced plantains, etc. for 15 years.

Fidelia’s business is located in the San Lorenzo park, where her customers are people who pass through there daily.

Fidelia is asking for this loan in order to buy more ingredients, such as plantains, salt, onions, potatoes, salsas, beef, chicken, lettuce,  beets, soft drinks, etc. to make her different types of dishes.  Her number of customers has increased and they are asking for a greater variety of dishes.

Fidelia will meet her financial needs with this loan.  Her dream is to have her son attend school and buy a house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2013.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,la socia cria gallinas y tambien la socia vende pasto y huevo sancochado,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia se dedica a este negocio 8 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar sus negocios de venta de pasto,huevo sancochados y crianza de animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Valentina still raises animals. She raises chickens and sells hay and parboiled eggs. Thanks to these activities, she gets ahead with her children. She has been doing it for eight years and does very well. Her dream is to expand her business.

Valentina is requesting a loan to buy chickens. She feels happy with the loan and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Juana, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. 

La socia sigue dedicandose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de arroz y azucar para su negocio.

La socia Juana está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” in the district of Andahuaylillas, located in the province of Quispicanchi, Cusco, Peru. 

Juana continues to make a living from her grocery store. She has had this business for a while and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into the business every day. Juana wants to be able to continue working in order to continue helping her family.

Juana is requesting the loan in order to buy rice and sugar for her business.

Juana is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue with her work so she can support her household.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar for her business

loans.name: Luzveña

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia se dedica al negocio 9 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los cuyes y gallinas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está satisfecha con el fruto de su trabajo y sacrificio, y por ello agradece a KIVA que le ayuda siempre en el fortalecimiento de su actividad económica y con sus proyectos académicos.
texts.en:
Luzveña continues to work in her business raising and selling small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. She fattens them and makes them grow, and later she sells them in various markets. She has had this business for nine years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell her guinea pigs and chickens. She has applied for a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

Luzveña is satisfied with the fruits of her labor and sacrifice. She is grateful to Kiva for always helping her to strengthen her business activity and with her academic plans.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Raimunda

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Raimunda, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. 

La socia sigue dedicandose al negocio de venta de golosinas,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de chicles,galletas,chupetines entre otros.

La socia Raimunda está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y con este trabajo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
This borrower is Raimunda, who belongs to the "Las Triunfadoras" communal bank in the district of Andahuaylillas and the province of Quispicanchis in Cusco, Peru.

She continues to work in her business selling candy. She has had this business for a good amount of time, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She works as a street vendor, selling to clients who order from her. She wishes to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She has applied for a loan to buy chewing gum, cookies, and lollipops, among others.

Raimunda is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue with her business so that she can provide for her household.

loans.use: to buy chewing gum, cookies, and lollipops, among others.

loans.name: Avetik

texts.en:
Avetik was born and currently lives in the village of Goght, which is in the Kotayk region of Armenia. He is 54 years old and lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law, daughter and grandchild. Avetik and his family members have to work hard days and nights in order to sustain their big family. The main income for Avetik and his family comes from their agricultural business. Their region is known for its delicious flavors and different varieties of sweet fruits, especially apples. 

Avetik has a large apple orchard. He also grows cherries and walnuts. Avetik sells the products from their orchard at the fruit markets in Yerevan. He also breeds cows and chickens on his farm. Avetik is very pleased by his agricultural business and happy that he can meet his big family's needs by earning profits from his farming.

Avetik wants to increase the number of his animals and hopes to receive a good profit next season. He is asking for a loan of 600,000 AMD to buy two calves. This is Avetik's first loan with Kiva and second loan with Nor Horizon. He hopes that he will have good success in the future.

loans.use: To buy two calves.

loans.name: Telesfora

texts.en:
Telesfora D. is from Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City. She is 56 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Telesfora owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Aside from these activities, she also manages a farm, planting and harvesting corn for sale.

In 2006, Telesfora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old. She is from the community of Ubay, Bohol. She is married and has a 16-year-old son. Delia sells vegetables to earn a living for her family. She is asking for 8,000 PHP to buy more vegetables such as eggplants, squash, ginger, onions, string beans and tomatoes.

Her loan will be a big help in enabling her to expand her business to earn a better income. She hopes to improve her business in the future and see her child become successful in his schooling.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, squash, ginger, onions, string beans and tomatoes.

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Davaa, 40, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi services to local people for many years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers and driving them to their destination in the shortest possible time. His wife is a manager at private hospital. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years, and it needs some serious repair. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, cements, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, he can repair and insulate his house. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and thereby contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
La socia se digue dedicando al trabajo como limpieza y cocinas en diferentes casas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este trbajo 5 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Gabina continues to make a living cleaning and cooking in different houses.  She works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m.  She has been doing this work for five years and it is going very well.  Her dream is to have a grocery store.

This member is requesting a loan in order to buy a television for her house.  

She feels grateful for the loan granted, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal DURABANK, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Abelardo sigue dedicandose a su negocio de mecánica, el socio se siente bien con su negocio el cual le trae satisfaciones tanto economicas como personales,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para su negocio.

El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Durabank", which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.  

Abelardo continues to make a living in his auto repair business, which brings him both economic and personal satisfaction.  He hopes to be able to continue working in this way so that he can continue supporting his family.

The member is requesting a loan in order to buy tires for his business.  He is grateful for the loan he has been given and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his business.

loans.name: Ergash

texts.ru: Эргаш пожилой человек в возрасте 60 лет. Он проживает в районе Шахритус. У него жена, двое сыновей и одна дочь. Все его дети взрослые и самостоятельные. Эргаш занимается земледелием и часть семейных расходов покрывает за счет этой деятельности. К тому же у него имеется две коровы, молоко которых идет на нужды семьи. Сейчас Эргаш намерен заняться животноводческим бизнесом. Он планирует закупать, откармливать и продавать крупнорогатый скот. У него есть опыт, а также  место для разведениея скота. Чтобы начать бизнес он обратился за кредитом для закупа двух бычков.
texts.en: Ergash is an middle-aged man of 60. He lives in Shakhritus, is married, and has two sons and a daughter. All of his children are grown and independent. Ergash is involved in farming, and this activity covers part of his familiy's living expenses. He also has two cows whose milk serves the needs of his family. Now Ergash wants to start an animal husbandry business. He plans to buy, fatten, and resell cattle. He has both the experience and a place to keep the cattle. To start his business, he has requested a loan to buy two bulls.

loans.use: to buy two bulls

loans.name: Baldorj

texts.en:
Baldorj is 31 years old and lives with his wife and son in a Ger (traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Monhsoyol, is currently attending specialized medical training, and his 5-year-old son, Hos-Erdene, goes to the local kindergarten. Baldorj has been working in various fields and worked as a driver of big trucks for the last several years. 

He is a well-experienced and hardworking man who is now planning to start his own business, being a transportation service provider with his own truck. He needs a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase bulk cement from the capital city (Ulaanbaatar) to sell to local customers. He said, "I want my business to be successful and to build my own house."

loans.use: to purchase bulk cement from the capital city (Ulaanbaatar) to sell to local customers.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 39 years old and married with 6 children. Five of her children are in school and she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Jenalyn has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, bread, canned goods and other groceries. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Farangis

texts.ru: Фарангису 21 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она очень трудолюбивая и умная девушка. Она окончила в 2009 году среднюю школу и поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. Фарагис данное время является студенткой 3 курса по специальности Финансы и кредит. Фарангис учится отлично и активно участвует во всех внеурочных мероприятиях. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Ее родители тоже не в состоянии оплатить за учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Farangis is 21, single, and lives with her parents. She is a very hardworking and bright young woman. She graduated high school in 2009 and entered the Tajikistan State University of Commerce. Currently Farangis is a third-year student majoring in finance and credit. She is an excellent student and actively participates in all extra curricular events. She needs to pay her tuition, but does not have any money. Her parents are also unable to pay. She is requesting a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is married and a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

Adelina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is listing Adelina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en:
Baljinnyam is 51 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a Ger (traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Oyungerel, helps her husband to run their family business, a grocery store. His daughter, Hishigzaya, is 23 years old and a sophomore student at the local university. 

Baljinnyam has been running his grocery store for 14 years and gained lot of experience and loyal customers over the years. He is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase organic vegetables and fruits from local producers to sell at his store. He is a hardworking, responsible and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase organic vegetables and fruits from local producers to sell at his grocery store.

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en:
Batsuren is 50 years old and lives with her husband and son in an apartment in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Jargalsaihan, is 50 years old and runs a small firewood and charcoal business, and her son, Batjavhlan, is 23 years old, a new graduate, and works at a state-owned enterprise. 

Batsuren has been working at an art school as a teacher of handcrafts for years, and is now retired and stays home. She is planning to start her own small retail business at home of selling handmade souvenir products, and is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory and materials to start her own handmade souvenir business at home. She is a hardworking, innovative and enthusiastic woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory and materials to start her own handmade souvenir business at home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes for resale, stock up on beauty products for her salon and buy a barbecue, tortillas and vegetables for her food stall.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa is a 48-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children in a Ger (traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband, Tsogtgerel, is 50 years old and works at local company. Her older child is enrolled in the university and her younger child attends the local secondary school.  Tsetsegmaa has been running a grocery store business at the local market for years, and has gained many customers' trust and a lot of experience in the business. 

She broadened her plot of land and is now starting to plant organic fruit trees on her land. She is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase small trees and soils to start her organic fruit production business. She is a hardworking, modest and positive woman.

loans.use: to purchase small trees and soils to start her organic fruit production business.

loans.name: Gemema

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Gemema works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling recycled materials. 

Gemema is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Ruth Filomena

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Ruth, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, de la provincia de Quispicanchis del Cusco – Perú. 

La socia sigue dedicandose al negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas, pollos y cuyes, la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

La socia Ruth está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con su actividad económica y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower is Ruth, who belongs to the "Las Triunfadoras" communal bank in the district of Andahuaylillas and the province of Quispicanchis in Cusco, Peru.

She continues to work in her business raising small animals, such as chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. She raises these animals so that she can sell them later to clients who order them. She has had this business for a good amount of time, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She wishes to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She has applied for a loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

Ruth is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue with her business, and she is committed to paying the established installments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Punsalmaa

texts.en:
Punsalmaa is 46 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in Tsogttsetsii soum of Umnugovi, Mongolia. His wife, Altantsetseg, is 50 years old and grows and sells organic vegetables from their plot of land. His son, Gantomor, is 22 years old and a new graduate currently looking for job, and his daughter, Siilegmaa, is 14 years old and studies at the local school. 

Punsalmaa has been working as a welder in local companies since 1991. He is a well-experienced and hardworking man who is starting his own business of auto repair and welding services in town, and is now requesting loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment and tools to start operating his business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to start operating his business in town.

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en: Luzvisminda is married and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 19 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She is saving enough money to expand her business and repair the family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 58 years old and married with two children, ages 18 and 20. She is from CPG, Bohol. For the past eight years, Juliana has been in the fishing business. 

Juliana is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets and bamboo for her boat. She is confident that her loan will have a good impact on her business. In the future, Juliana hopes to be successful in sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and bamboo

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a married woman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 15 years now. This is the source of their income.

Beatriz is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. Through this, she will be able to improve their fishing business as well as their income. In the future, she hopes to make her fishing business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Batzul

texts.en:
Batzul is 31 years old lives with his wife and two sons in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His sons, Baasanjargal and Bayanjargal, are 3 and 5 years old and they go to a local kindergarten. Since 2008, Batzul has been running a taxi service in town. His wife has worked as saleswoman in a local market for last three years and has obtained a lot of experience. She is now starting her own retail clothing business in a local market. 

Batzul is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to invest in his wife's new clothing business. He and his wife are both hardworking, responsible and well-behaved people.

loans.use: to invest in his wife's new clothing business

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is a 36-year-old farmer from the community of Ubay, Bohol. She has grown rice for ten years now to provide for her family. Her farm provides an income of 10,000 PHP every harvest season. She is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy seedlings, fertilizer and insecticide.  

Maria Luz hopes that she can continue to improve and expand her business so she can consistently afford to provide her children a better life through education.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Bakhraid

texts.en:
Bakhraid is a 35-year-old housewife with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a welder. 

Bakhraid has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is taking out this loan for her husband to buy welding material such as iron rods, welding rods, soldering rods, iron sheets, etc. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She will use the profit for household expenses. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase welding material

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is 30 years old and married with two children. Her husband works in a woodshop. For about the past 15 years, Kiran has been running her own beauty shop. She is a hardworking and diligent woman. Since she was a child, Kiran has completed various beautician courses and she is an excellent beautician by profession. She is a very skilled and independent woman and she helps her husband by running her own business. Kiran spends all of the income generated from her business on her children's education so that they can have a bright future.

Kiran is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business and add some more space to her salon. Her clients are increasing day by day and her current space is too congested. Kiran will also use her loan to purchase some cosmetic products such as lipsticks, facial scrubs, and new hair stylers. Her loan will help her to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to expand her beauty salon and buy cosmetics

loans.name: Dally

texts.en:
Dally is 44 years old and married with one kid. For the past six years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Dally has received 13 previous loans from NWTF and, more recently, Kiva to sustain her business.
