Dally is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 44-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and seven children. Since 2004, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central bazaar. He is a very hardworking and honest man who is confident about his family’s bright future.

Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her husband's shop. Her husband will buy a variety of fresh vegetables and offer more products to his clients to increase his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 35 years old, a hard-working mother of three children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and children. She is a very skilled woman and she is very expert in stitching up dresses. She has been doing this tailoring work for 10 years. All the people in her area are very well satisfied and happy with her work. She provides her services at a very reasonable amount, and that's why her workload is increasing day by day.

Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business by purchasing one more sewing machine. She would be able to stitch dresses more appropriately and efficiently in less time with a new sewing machine. This would increase her net income and savings. She would spend the profit amount on the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, a 42-year-old hardworking housewife, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, three daughters and two sons. Her husband is a janitor by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to meet the household expenses of his family. Therefore for the past five years he has been supplementing his income by driving a taxi at night.

Currently unable to generate any taxi income because it needs to be repaired, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help pay the cost of repairs. With future profits, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop.

Nasreen desires to provide quality education to all of her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very much thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: To pay the cost of repairing her husband's taxi

loans.name: Naomi Akake

texts.fr: Madame Naomi Akake  réside au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et elle exerce une double activité de commerce et de couture. Elle a démarré ses activités il y’a plus de 05 ans. Membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle a déjà remboursé  un prêt antérieur, elle sollicite un nouveau  crédit de 400.000 francs CFA pour les besoins de ses activités. Face à une forte demande de sa clientèle, elle  souhaite avec l’aide de son financement  renforcer son fonds de roulement afin qu’elle puisse satisfaire les exigences de ses clients. A partir des revenus générés par ce financement, elle pourrait  booster davantage ses activités. Alors, elle aura ainsi l’occasion de rendre meilleur les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son futur projet d’ouvrir son propre atelier de  couture afin de travailler pour son propre compte.
texts.en:
Mrs. Naomi Akake lives in Senegal. She is a married woman who works in trade and who is also a seamstress. She started these activities over five years ago. She is a member of the local U-IMCEC branch, where she has previously obtained and repaid one loan. She is seeking a new loan of 400,000 francs CFA to help sustain her activities. 

To meet customer demand, she will use her credit to strengthen her working capital. This will help her to meet the needs of her customers. The revenue earned with this loan will bolster her activities, which will allow her to improve her family’s food situation. Her goal is to open a sewing shop and run her own business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sew items for sale.

loans.name: G.s El Cerro#2 Group

texts.es:
La Señora Brenda es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 10 años.
Doña Brenda vende en su comunidad a diario y en los distintos caseríos cercanos a la misma, necesita el préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, shorts, blusas, camisetas, etc. los cuales necesita para cubrir la demanda que tiene su producto.
Doña Brenda al igual que sus compañeros de grupo esperan con  el préstamo poder contar con el producto necesario para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, y a su vez que las ventas en sus negocios aumenten y gracias a esto poder mejorar un poco la calidad de vida de sus familias.
Doña Brenda espera hacer crecer su negocio en unos años y de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia y  que sus hijos continúen con los estudios para que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mayores oportunidades en la vida.
Doña Bilma  tiene 35 años su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 10 años.
Doña Gelmy tiene 29 años su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace 8 años.
Doña Nerhy, tiene 42 años su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace 15 años.



Choluteca, Honduras – Abril 2013
texts.en:
Brenda is a very responsible and hard-working woman who lives in a community in the south of Honduras together with her husband and their two children.  Her business is selling new clothing and she has been in this line of work for 10 years.

Brenda sells her products daily in her community and in other nearby villages.  She needs this loan to buy more products such as pants (trousers), shirts, skirts, dresses, shorts, blouses, t-shirts, etc. which she needs to meet the demand that she currently has.  Brenda and her fellow group members hope that this loan will enable them to buy all the products they need to fill their customers' orders and that their sales increase so that they can improve their families' quality of life a little.

Brenda hopes to grow her business over the next few years so that she can continue supporting her family and so that her children can stay in school.  She would like her children to become upstanding citizens with better opportunities in life.

Bilma is 35 years old and has been running a convenience store for 10 years.

Gelmy is 29 years old and has been selling tortillas for 8 years.

Nerhy is 42 years old and has been selling tortillas for 15 years.

Coluteca, Honduras - April 2013

loans.use: to buy pants (trousers), shirts, skirts, dresses, shorts, blouses, t-shirts etc. for her business

loans.name: Nighat's Group

texts.en:
Nighat is 45 years old, a hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, three sons and one daughter. Three of her children are currently studying in primary school. Nighat's husband is a laborer but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

Nighat is a very responsible woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's educational expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past 11 years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Nighat, as a member of 3-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future and her production can increase. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams of building her own house. She also desires to expand her business and to provide quality education to her children. With the profit amount she will pay her house rent.

 Nighat and her family are very much thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

NOTE : In the picture Nighat is in white, standing in front.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is a married woman and a mother of four children from CPG, Bohol. 

She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than seven years now, together with her husband. This is the source of her income.

Caridad is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat. Through this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Caridad dreams of improving their fishing business so that it will generate more income necessary for the needs of the family such as for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 36-year-old independent woman. She has four children and her husband died six years ago. 

She has been doing a cloth business in her house for six years and this is the only source of income for her family. Due to the large household expenses, she is facing a lot of problems in life.

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business by opening a garment shop in the market as she is not getting enough customers in her house. She would also buy some new variety of shirts and dresses to attract more customers. This loan could help her to increase her monthly income and savings for the better future of her children.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her.

loans.use: To open a garment shop in the market.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 43-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business of selling auto spare parts 12 years ago. 

Naseem, as a member of a four-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to increase his supply of spare parts including chains, tyres, tubes, brake shoes, wheels, etc, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. 

Naseem hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy chains, tyres, tubes, brake shoes, wheels, etc.

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel is 21 years old and married with a two-year-old daughter. She is from the town of Ubay in Bohol Philippines. For the past five years, she has been raising hogs to earn a living. She also buys and sells scrap items to earn extra income. 

Maribel is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan to buy feed, medicine, and cement. She will use the cement to renovate her house. In the future, Maribel hopes to continue her business and earn better for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and cement

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DURABANK, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua con su negocio de escuela de choferes,la socia se siente bien con su negocio el cual le trae satisfaciones tanto economicas como personales,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.


La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para uno de sus carros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank DURABANK, located in the district of Cusco, in Cusco province and department. 

The member continues operating her driving school business. She feels good about her business which gives her personal as well as economic satisfaction. She hopes to be able to continue working in this business to continue supporting her family. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase tires for one of her cars. 

She is grateful for the loan that she has been granted and she is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase tires for one of her cars.

loans.name: G.s Las Brisas Group

texts.es:
La Señora Ana es una persona muy trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 8 años.
Doña Ana es muy conocida y visitada por los vecinos de su comunidad y demás personas que transitan por ahí. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como ser maíz, arroz, manteca, frijoles, churros, refrescos, azúcar, pan, café, etc. y así surtir más su negocio. 
Doña Ana al igual que sus compañeros de grupo espera que el préstamo les sirva de mucho ya que contaran con los productos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y a su vez esperan que  aumenten sus ventas para mejorar un poco el estilo de vida de sus familias.
Doña Ana su sueño es poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos continúen con los estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.
El Joven Alejandro, tiene 22 años su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 3 años.
Doña Gloria, tiene 43 años su negocio es la venta de ropa usada desde hace 15 años.




Choluteca, Honduras – Abril 2013
texts.en:
Ana is a very hard-working person who lives in a community in the south of Honduras together with her two children.  She has been running a convenience store business for 8 years.

Ana is very well known and her store is very popular with her neighbors and other people who pass by.  She needs this loan to buy more products such as corn, rice, butter, beans, churros (fritters), soft drinks, sugar, bread, coffee, etc. so that she can further stock her business.

Ana and her fellow group members believe that this loan will be very useful as it will enable them to buy the products they need to meet their customers' needs.  They also believe that it will help them to increase their sales so that they can improve their families' lifestyles a little.

Ana's dream is to continue supporting her family so that her children can stay in school and enjoy better opportunities in life.

Alejandro is a young man of 22.  He has been running a convenience store for 3 years.

Gloria is 43 years old and she has been running a business selling used clothing for 15 years.

Choluteca, Honduras - April 2013.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, butter, beans, churros, soft drinks, sugar, bread, coffee, etc. for her business

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a 45-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. 

She raises chickens. She has been raising chickens for almost 10 years. She earns 8,000 PHP a month by doing this poultry business.

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy additional chickens and feeds. In the future, Adela hopes that she will be successful in her poultry business to improve her family's livelihood status and to save for the future.

loans.use: to  buy additional chickens and feeds.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is a 63-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has nine grown children. 

She engages in a food vending business. She sells rice cakes and she has been selling them for almost 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. Aside from  food vending, Antonina also engages in farming. She grows rice. 

Antonina requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy rice and other ingredients. Antonina hopes that she can expand both businesses to continue to send her children to school, especially those who are not yet married, for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy rice and other ingredients.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 51 years old and supports ten people in his family. For the last 18 years, he has worked as a blacksmith and earns a monthly income of 45,000 KES. 

David is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase stock metal to use in his business. He will use the anticipated profit from his business is to buy a plot of land for himself. David hopes and dreams of growing financially.

loans.use: to purchase stock metals

loans.name: Dutsimbatare Group

texts.fr:
Médiatrice fait partie du groupe  Dutsimbatare  et habite à Gitega. Elle a 42  ans et est mariée à Paul, un cultivateur.  Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants, âgés de  2 à 14 ans, dont 4 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  bière banane depuis 2 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière de banane ; et deux caisses de bière industrielle, à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Médiatrice, age 42, is a member of the Dutsimbatare group and she lives in Gitega. She is married to a farmer named Paul, and they have six children aged 2 to 14, four of whom go to school. She has been selling banana beer for two years. 

This is her 3rd loan with Turame, and she plans to use her credit to bolster her working capital. She will buy a large supply of banana beer and two cases of industrial beer. The sale of these products will help to boost her revenue.

loans.use: to bolster her working capital and buy a large  supply of banana beer as well as two cases of industrial beer to sell.

loans.name: Airesty

texts.en:
Airesty is a 32-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has six children. The oldest child is 11 while the youngest is 3. 

She operates a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like eggs, bread, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and canned goods. Aside from operating a retail store, Airesty also engages in a buying and selling business to gain additional income for her family. She buys and sells fish, cassava and sweet potatoes. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more various fish and additional sweet potatoes and cassava to resell.

In the future, Airesty would like to expand her business to improve her family's livelihood status and also to save for the education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more various fish and additional sweet potatoes and cassava to resell.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 48-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of nine children, three sons and six daughters. Her husband owns a vegetable shop in the market that is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of fresh vegetables in his shop. 

Currently, he is interested to offer more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of funding, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Balqees, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase vegetables from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. 

With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Balqees is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is 47 years old and a father with two sons and two daughters. For the past 14 years, he has been selling milk. Rustam is a hardworking man and his business is the only source of income for his family. All of his clients like the delicious milk he sells.

Rustam is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase two buffalos. He would like to expand his business in the future. Rustam's loan will help increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase two buffalos

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 51 years old and married. She comes from Kinuman, Ozamis City. For the past five years, Susan has been a farmer who earns 8,000 PHP each month planting and harvesting corn and root crops to sell. 

Susan is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicado al negocio de restaurant,la socia vende desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas,caldos y tallarines,la socia y tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,verduras,pollo y carne para cocinar.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues working in her restaurant business where she sells breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She prepares different dishes such as chicken and potatoes, stews and noodles.  She has been in this business for 10 years and it is doing very well.  Her dream is to expand her restaurant business.  She is requesting this loan to buy rice, vegetables, chicken and meat for preparing her dishes.

The member is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, chicken and meat to make meals

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicandose al negocio de preparacion de tortas,la socia lleva buen tiempo en su negocio el cual le trae satisfaciones tanto economicas como personales,la socia trabaja a pedido de acuerdo a los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como harina,azucar entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member prepares and sells cakes.  Her business has gone well and is both economically and personally satisfying.  She works hard to fill orders from her customers.  She hopes to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, and other things like this.

She is very thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the re-payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, and other things like this.

loans.name: Badar

texts.en:
Badar is a 43-year-old, hardworking housewife with four sons and three daughters and is a resident of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

For the past eight years, her husband has been driving a van, which is the only source of income for his family. Badar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her husband's transportation business by buying a new van. They are saving money for this purpose and with the addition of the loan amount, they would be able to buy this van. This will not only help expand their transportation business, but it will also help increase their monthly income. 

She is very hopeful that the loan will be productive so that they can meet the basic necessities of their family and provide education to their children.

loans.use: to expand the transport business by buying a van.

loans.name: Rina Elena

texts.es:
La socia Rina Elena sigue dedicandose al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le trae satisfaciones tanto economica como personales,la socia elabora chompas,carteras chuyos entre otros,siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de lanas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rina sells crafts.  She has worked in this business many years and it gives her both personal and economic satisfaction.  She makes Peruvian sweaters, hats, purses, and other things.  By doing this work, she is able to help her family get ahead.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy wool for her business.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the re-payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy wool for her business.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 49-year-old hardworking and an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been in the business of cloth selling for almost 15 years. She purchases cloth from different areas and sells it in the main market at a profitable price. 

Parveen is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband makes his living as a daily worker whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. She faced many problems in her early married life, but now her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in meeting the needs of the family members. 

To cope with the increasing demand during the summer season, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan as a member of two-person group, to purchase variety of cloth in different colors. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of profits on the improvement of her house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cloth.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a 34-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has five children. Chona and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Chona is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and other equipment. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Chona has hopes of making their business a success and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and other equipment

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 36 years old and blessed with six children aged between 12 and four years old. She owns a 'posho' (cornmeal) mill machine in Kabarnet and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning an income of KES. 10,000.

With her fourth loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD, Martha intends to use the amount to pay school fees for her children and also buy more dry maize to grind and sell as flour to her customers.The profits she earns from her current business will be used to repay the loan and purchase stock of dry maize.

Her dream is to see her business expand and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To pay school fees and also buy more dry maize to grind and sell as flour

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman who has two children. She is 44 years old and resides at Gata Daku, Clarin. Evelyn owns and operates a farm to earn a living, planting and harvesting corn and vegetables for sale. She's been in this business for 12 years. 

Recently, she requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, Evelyn wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.en:
Nurlan is a married client who is 21 years old and lives with his family of four members. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and parents in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

For the past two years, he has been selling water hoses for gardens, villas, parks, and for business purposes. This business is very profitable because nobody in town is doing this business.

Nurlan's business requires effort because it makes him commit himself to this occupation. He makes a good profit because of the demand. The hoses are used a lot everywhere because of agricultural activities.
 
Now, Nurlan has applied for a loan of AZN 1,900 from Aqroinvest Credit Union to buy water hoses. This is his first loan. He believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of his business.

loans.use: to buy water hoses to sell.

loans.name: Urpis De Confraternidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPIS DE CONFRATERNIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Alicia ella es conviviente y tiene 44 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ferretería, la socia vende clavos, pinturas, herramientas, martillos entre otros, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ferretería. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar clavos, pinturas y martillos.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de regalos, negocio de ferretería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesanía.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the 'Urpis de Confraternidad' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Alicia is 44 years old, lives with her partner and has two children.  She has a hardware business where she works selling nails, paint, tools, hammers and other products.  She works from 8.00am to 7.00pm and has been in this business, which is doing very well, for 8 years.  Alicia's dream is to expand her hardware business.  She is requesting this loan to buy nails, paint and hammers.

*The member whose picture is attached to that of the main group had her photo taken at a later date.  She requested permission to do this for work reasons.

The other members of this group work selling gifts, running a hardware business, running a convenience store business and selling handicrafts.
 
Alicia is grateful to the people who will participate in her dream in this way and pledges to make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy nails, paint and hammers

loans.name: Amigos Del Milenio Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMIGOS DEL MILENIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia Rosario  tiene 49 años de edad ,02 hijos y es casada, la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como colonias, perfumes, cremas entre otros, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus amistades y familiares, que le solicitan, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como perfumes y colonias.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de ferretería, venta de productos de belleza, llamadas telefónicas, trabajadores del sector privado.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde  a la reunión por  motivos de trabajo.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
These members belong to the 'Amigos del Milenio' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Rosario is 49 years old, married and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling beauty products such as colognes, perfumes, creams, etc.  She makes her sales door to door, selling to friends and family members who request her goods.  Rosario has been in this business for years and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day.  She is a responsible, determined person and this is how she provides for her family.

Rosario is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as perfumes and colognes.

The other members of this group run a hardware business, sell beauty products, provide phone service and work in the private sector.

The member whose photo is attached to the main group photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

Rosario is grateful for the loan she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as perfumes and cologne

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 37 years old, married to Nancy. They are both blessed with five children. Leonard has been in the butcher business for the last seven years with monthly income of KES 46,000.

Leonard has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) which he planned to use to purchase sheep and goats for slaughtering.

The anticipated profit from his expanded business will be used to buy more cattle for his business. Leonard's hope and dream is to grow financially.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for slaughtering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula, of Tangub City, Philippines, is a 55-year-old married woman, with nine children. 

To earn a living, Teodula owns a farm, planting and harvesting corn for sale. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2006 and she gains access to the financial services of the cooperative. 

Recently, Teodula has requested and amount of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. In the future, she wants to cultivate the vacant land to generate more income, for better living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have electricity installed in her home

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Doña Luisa, habitante del barrio Laureles sur, una zona donde hay mucha delincuencia, ella continua laborando como empleada domestica y con mucho trabajo está tratando de hacerle las mejoras a su vivienda, para poderles heredar a sus hijos  una casa segura. Este crédito que solicita es para terminar de construir un cuarto que ya había empezado doña luisa, necesita comprar materiales como cerámica, cemento, para instalación de cerámica en el piso, continuar paredes entre otros, todo esto también es posible gracias al apoyo de su pareja quien trabaja como carpintero.
texts.en:
Luisa lives in Laureles Sur neighborhood, an area which experiences a lot of crime.  She continues working as a cleaner and is working hard to make some improvements to her home so that her children can inherit a secure house.  

Luisa is requesting this loan to finish building a room that has already been started.  She needs to buy materials such as tiles and cement to lay tiling on the floor and to continue with the walls, etc.  All of this is also possible thanks to the support of her partner who works as a carpenter.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand, iron and tiles

loans.name: Tamara Kruspkaya

texts.es: Tamara, una joven que ha venido apoyando a sus padres con su labor como médico, es soltera sin hijos, quiere lo mejor para sus padres de esa manera retribuye los sacrificios que han hecho para que ella sea una profesional, Tamara con sus créditos ha hecho unos cambios en su hogar. Con este nuevo prestamo que solicita desea construir un cuarto el cual es necesario para su privacidad por lo que comprara los materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Tamara is a young woman who has been supporting her parents through her job as a doctor.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  Tamara wants the best for her parents so that she can repay the sacrifices that they made in order for her to become a professional.  She has used her previous loans to make some changes to her home.

Tamara is requesting this new loan to build a room which is necessary for her privacy.  She will use the loan to buy construction supplies.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, roofing purlins and blocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace his current electrical installation

loans.name: Grupo La Fe Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  Grupo  la  Fe está conformado por nueve integrantes, uno varón y  ocho mujeres. Ellos son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Estas personas se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, de buenas costumbres. Con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar una carrera y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. Razón por la que trabajan arduamente para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
La coordinadora del banco comunal Grupo la Fe es Juana y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, azúcar, leche, pan, frijoles,  aceite, jugos, leche, huevos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El  banco comunal Grupo la  Fe agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The community bank Grupo La Fe [The Faith Group] is made up of nine members -- one man and eight women.  They are from Malpaisillo, a place that is situated in the western part of the country.  

These people describe themselves as being hardworking, responsible, with good habits, and with a desire to improve themselves.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, they were not able to study for a degree and found themselves having to work from a young age.  For this reason, they work hard in order to provide a better future for their children.

The coordinator of the community bank Grupo La Fe is Juana, and her business is a pulpería, located in her house.  A pulpería is a small store that sells groceries in small quantities such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, beans, oil, juices and eggs.  She dedicates around 12 hours a day to her business.

The goal of the loan is to invest in capital and to stock her business so that in a not-so-distant future, she can get better earnings.

The community bank Grupo La Fe is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people with limited resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can make a respectable living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store with items such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, beans, oil, juices, and eggs.

loans.name: Diomaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Diomaye est un homme marié qui  vit au Sénégal avec sa famille. Il s’active dans le secteur de la mécanique depuis 07 ans et exerce en même temps  le commerce de pièces détachées au profit de ses clients. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui  permet de prendre soins de sa famille (nourriture).Il démarre chaque jour ses activités a 7 heures pour boucler sa journée de travail  a 19 heures. Il  sollicite un crédit de 250 000 au niveau du  guichet de l’UIMCEC ou il est membre et ou il a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Avec ce financement il a l’intention de  payer les uniformes qu’il a commandé pour ses employés. Le  port d’uniforme pourra augmenter la visibilité de son activité ce qui pourrait se traduire par une augmentation de ses revenus. Ainsi il pourra diversifier ses prestations  en produits  et services pour ses clients. Il pourra ainsi faire face a la concurrence en attirant  beaucoup plus de clients et améliorer les  conditions de vie de sa famille. Il souhaite devenir un grand vendeur de pièces détachées.
texts.en: Mister Diomaye is a married man who live in Senegal with his family. He has been active in the mechanics sector for 7 years and at the same time practices the sale of spare parts to benefit his customers.The revenue that his business brings him allows him to take care of his family (food). Each day he starts his businesses at 7am and finishes his work day at 7pm. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 from the branch of the UIMCEC where he is a member and where he has already repaid a previous loan. With this financing he has the intention of paying for the uniforms that he ordered for his employees. Wearing uniforms will be able to increase the visibility of his business which could translate into an increase in his revenue. Thus he will be able to diversify the products and services he offers his customers. He will thus be able to cope with the competition by attracting many more customers and improving the living conditions of his family. He hopes to become a great seller of spare parts.

loans.use: to pay for the uniforms of his employees.

loans.name: Maimouna's Group

texts.fr:
le groupe est composé de 5 femmes qui habitent le même village;il est a son 24eme cycle de prêt.les femmes ont une bonne cohésion sociale et font toutes le commerce .
Maimouna est la représentante du groupe; elle a tendu la main sur la photo .Elle est marié et mère de 6 garçons et une fille .son ainé a 35 ans et son cadet a 12 ans.Elle fait du commerce de fruits et légumes.Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des carottes a 30000f des papayes à 30000f des mangues à 300000f et des haricots à 100000f. Elle achète la marchandise dans son village pour aller revendre à la capitale.Elle fait cette activité depuis 36 ans.
Avec ses bénéfices elle prend en charge la scolarité de ses enfants,elle aide aussi son marie dans les dépenses de la maison et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of five women from the same village. It is on its 24th loan cycle. The women have good social cohesion, and they all work in commerce. Maimouna is the group's representative, the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is a married mother of six boys and one girl. The oldest is 35 years old, and the youngest is 12. 

Maimouna does commerce in fruit & vegetables. With her loan, she intends to purchase carrots at 30,000 francs, papayas at 30,000 francs, mangoes at 300,000 francs, and beans at 100,00 francs. She purchases her merchandise in her village and then resells them in the capital. She has been in this business for 36 years. 

With her profits, she covers her children's schooling costs. She also helps out her husband in covering household expenses and the children's healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase carrots, beans, papaya, and a field of mangoes

loans.name: Dios Proveera Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Dios Proveerá está conformado por diez integrantes, madres solteras con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son  originarias de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde muy temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
La coordinadora del banco comunal Dios Proveerá es Fresia y tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda  que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, jugos, sal, detergentes. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Dios Proveera agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The 'Dios Proveerá' (God Will Provide) community bank has ten members who are all single mothers.  Between them, they have 20 dependent children.  They are all from Malpaisillo, in the north of the country.  These women are responsible, hard-working people who have a desire to improve themselves.  Sadly, they were unable to study as they lacked the necessary financial support and needed to work from a very early age in order to help out with their household expenses.

The coordinator of this community bank is Fresia, whose business is running a 'pulperia' which is located in her home.  A 'pulperia' is a small store which sells food products in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, eggs, juice, salt, and detergents.  The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so that, in the not-too-distant future, she can make better income.

The Dios Proveera community bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to people in poor countries such as Nicaragua, enabling them to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her convenience store with products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juice, salt and detergents

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 32 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 22 décembre 2012. Il est constitué par des femmes venant du même village et ceux des environs. Elles font comme activité du commerce. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations au sein du banc villageois.
Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Awa est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 4 filles. Le plus âgée de ses enfants a 20 ans et le plus jeune 4 ans. Elle mène comme activité le commerce. Elle vend des légumes. Avec le prêt elle va acheter de la carotte, du manioc , des choux, de l'oignon pour les revendre. 
Les bénéfices obtenus lui servent à acheter des brebis qu'elle élève et aussi à renforcer ses épargnes dans la banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group of 32 women is part of the 'banc villageois' created on December 22, 2012. It is composed of women from one village and its surrounding area. They work in commerce and maintain good relations within the 'banc villageois'. 

Standing at the right in the photo with her hand raised, Awa is 39 years old and a married mother of seven children, including four girls. The oldest of her children is 20, and the youngest is 4. Awa has a business. She sells vegetables. With this loan, she is going to purchase carrots, cassava, cabbage, and onions to resell. The profits gotten will be used to purchase baby goats she will raise and also to bolster her savings at the 'banc villageois'.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: G.s Vida Eterna Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre de 3  hijos, vive con su esposo y su negocio es la venta de productos de nacatamales frutas y verduras,  cuenta con más de 20 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad generadora de ingresos.
Doña Santos tiene muy buena clientela en su mayoría los vecinos de su comunidad y personas que transitan por su domicilio, está solicitando el apoyo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, carnes pollo, res, cerdo, espaguetis, embutidos, sopas instantáneas y materia prima para la elaboración de nacatamales.
Doña Santos al igual que sus compañeros de grupo esperan que la inversión que realicen a sus negocios, les contribuyan a tener una mayor existencia de producto, lo que les permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Santos su sueños es darle una buena educación profesional a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida y engrandecer mas su negocio.
Doña Eugenia cuenta con una pulpería.
Doña Gregoria vende de frutas. 
Doña Yamileth se dedica a la venta de pan y granos básicos   


Danli, Honduras – Abril del  2013
texts.en:
Santos is 41 years old, is mother to 3 children, and lives with her husband.  Her business is the sale of nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales], fruits and vegetables.  She has been engaged in this income-generating activity for more than 20 years.

Santos has very good customers, the majority of whom are neighbors in her community and people who pass through her house.  She is applying for the loan to buy rice, sugar, shortening, sodas, meats, chicken, beef, pork, pastas, cold cuts, instant soups and ingredients for making nacatamales.

Santos, as well as others in her group, hope that the investment they make in their businesses helps them increase production, which will help them increase their earnings, improve their living conditions and grow their businesses.

Eugenia has a small grocery store.  Gregoria sells fruit.  Yamileth makes her living selling bread and staple foods.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, shortening, sodas, meats, chicken, beef, pork, pastas, cold cuts, instant soups, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Maguette's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est composé de 3 femmes qui habitent même  le quartier. Elle font la même activité et ont une bonne cohésion sociale. Maguette est la représentante du groupe et a tendu sa mains sur la photo.Elle est marié et mère de 4 enfants et un qui lui est confié.son ainé a 14 ans et son cadet 8 ans.Elle fait du commerce de fruit et a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.Avec son prêt elle compte acheter  400kg de melons; 100Kg de mandarines; 400kg de mangues; 200kg d'oranges.Elle expose sa marchandise sur une table au marché.
Avec ses Bénéfices elle prend en charge les besoins scolaires de ses enfants et paie la nourriture a la famille.
texts.en:
The group consists of 3 women who live in the same neighborhood. They are in the same business and have good social cohesion. 

Maguette is the representative of the group and raised her hand in the photo. She is married and mother to 4 children and one who is entrusted to her. Her oldest is 14 years old and her youngest is 8 years old. She sells fruit and has good experience in this domain. With her loan she plans to buy 400 kg of melons, 100 kg of mandarins, 400 kg of mangoes, and 200 kg of oranges. She displays her merchandise on a table at the market.

With her profits she takes care of the school needs of her children and pays for the family's food.

loans.use: to buy 400 kg of melons, 100 kg of mandarins, 400 kg of mangoes and 200 kg of oranges.

loans.name: Maréme's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe est composé de 7 femmes qui habitent la même zone; elle on une bonne cohésion sociale et font toutes le commerce. Maréme est la représentante du groupe, elle est marié et mère de 6 enfants dont 2 filles et 4 garçons.Elle a tendu sa main sur la photo,et fait du commerce de fruit,Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des mangues à 300000f ,des papayes ;des pastèques et des citrons à 200000f. Elle achète sa marchandise dans les champs de sa zone et part au marché de la capital la plus fréquenté pour vendre. elle est très expérimenté sur ce domaine pour car son avantage c'est le fait d’habiter dans une zone maraîchère. Avec ses bénéfices elle aide son marie dans les dépenses de la maison et  la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: The group consists of 7 women who live in the same zone. They have good social cohesion and are all shopkeepers. Maréme is the representative of the group. She is married and mother to 6 children of whom 2 are girls and 4 are boys. She raised her hand in the photo and sells fruit. With her loan she plans to buy mangoes at 300,000 f, papayas, watermelons and lemons at 200,000 f. She buys her merchandise in the fields of her zone and goes to the most frequented market of the capital to sell. She is very experienced in this domain since her advantage is living in a market gardening zone. With her profits she helps her husband with the expenses of the home and the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy mangoes at 300,000 f, papayas, watermelons and lemons at 200,000 f.

loans.name: Kandialang Soce Group

texts.fr: CE GROUPE EST CONTITUE SUITE AU BON VOISINAGE ET LEUR BONNE PROGRESSION. ELLES ONT TOUJOURS REMBOURSE LEURS PRETS SANS DIFFICULTE AVEC LES INTERETS Y AFFERANT. MADAME FATOUMATA QUI EST A LA DROITE DE LA PHOTO LEVANT LA MAIN EST LA REPRESENTANTE DU GROUPE. ELLE EST AGEE DE 44 ANS ET MERE DE 2 FILLES UNE AGEE DE 26 ANS ET L AUTRE DE 22 ANS. ELLE EST DIVORCEE. ELLE PRATIQUE L ACTIVITE DE VENTE D HABILLEMENT DEPUIS PLUS DE 10 ANS. LES BENEFICES SERVIRONT DE PRENDRE EN CHARGE LES FRAIS DE SCOLARITE DE SA DEUXIEME FILLE.
texts.en: This group was formed due to good neighborhood ties and good development. They have always repaid their loans and pertaining interest without difficulty. Madam Fatoumata who is on the right in the photo raising her hand is the representative of the group. She is 44 years old and mother to 2 girls, one 26 years old and the other 22 years old. She is divorced. She has been in business selling clothing for more than 10 years. The profits will serve to take care of the school fees of her second daughter.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel  de  29  años de edad es soltero,  tiene  01 hijo  que depende de él, vive con sus hermanos en una comunidad de  San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Don Juan Manuel no  tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 02 años  a la venta de abarrotería, frescos y detergentes, sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato y accesibilidad de su negocio.
Don Juan es emprendedor con deseos de salir  adelante y mejorar su condición de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, varillas, grava, etc. para  mejora de su vivienda ya que esta terminando de hacer una pila y un baño y el dinero lo necesita para la construcción de la pila, bañó y el techo del mismo. 
Don Juan con el apoyo de este crédito espera suplir la necesidad que tiene de construir su baño que tanto lo necesita, está contento por el apoyo a su negocio y ahora para su mejora de vivienda. 
Don Juan su sueño es tener su casa propia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Juan Manuel, 29 years old, is single and has one son who depends on him.  He lives with his siblings in a community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras.

Juan Manuel does not have his own house and for two years, has been making a living selling groceries, soft drinks and detergents.  His customers prefer him for his good service and the accessibility of his business.  Juan is an entrepreneur with desires to get ahead and improve his living conditions.  

He is applying for this loan to buy cement, bricks, bars, gravel, etc. to improve his housing since he is finishing construction of a sink and bathroom, and needs the money for the construction of the sink, bathroom and roof.

With the support of this loan, Juan hopes to fulfill his need to construct his bathroom, that he so needs.  He is happy for the support to his business and now for the improvement to his housing.  His dream is to have his own home.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, bars, gravel, etc. for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to waterproof the roof of her house.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El señor Esteban  de 51 años  de edad es casado  vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación,  se dedica desde hace 27  años al negocio de venta de ropa nueva,  frutas y reparación de zapatos.
Don Esteban  su  negocio está  ubicado en la comunidad de  San Lorenzo, al sur de honduras, en su negocio el vende ropa de todas las clases,  repara zapatos, vende frutas como sandias y mango, sus clientes son todas las personas que pasan por la calle de un mercado  de San Lorenzo.
Don Esteban es un hombre trabajador con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de blusas, pantalones, camisas, faldas, calzonetas y vestidos para damas.
Don Esteban con el apoyo del préstamo surtirá su negocio y aprovechara la venta del día de  las madres, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con PRISMA.
Don Esteban su sueño es mejorar su condición de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Esteban is 51 years old, married, and lives with his wife in their home.  For 27 years, he has made his living in the business of selling new clothing and fruits, and repairing shoes.  His business is located in the community of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras.  

In his business he sells all types of clothing, repairs shoes, and sells fruits like watermelon and mangoes.  His customers are all the people who pass through the streets of a market in San Lorenzo.  

Esteban is a hardworking man with desires to get ahead.  He is applying for a loan to buy blouses, pants, shirts, skirts, swimming trunks and ladies' dresses.

With the support of the loan, Esteban will stock his business and take advantage of sales for mother's day.  He is very happy to continue working with PRISMA.  His dream is to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts, skirts, swimming trunks and dresses for his business.

loans.name: Ndeye Ndieme's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 35 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 22 décembre 2012. Il est constitué par des femmes venant du même village et ceux des environs. Elles font comme activité du commerce. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations au sein du banc villageois.
Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main ,Awa est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants, 4 garçons, 4 filles.
Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter 2 moutons à raison de 20000f l'un pour les engraisser et de l'aliment de bétail pour leur nourriture. Si toute fois l'argent reste je prépare de la crème glacée pour le vendre.
Les bénéfices me permettent de renforcer la vente de crème glacée et aussi mon épargne. Ce que je gagne de cette activité me permet de payer électricité et assurer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group of 35 women is part of the "banc villageois" that was created on December 22, 2012. It consists of women from the same town and surroundings. They are all in retail business. They have good relationships at the heart of the "banc villageois." 

Standing on the right in the photo and raising her hand, Awa is 49 years old. She is married and mother to 8 children, 4 boys, 4 girls.

With the loan received she is going to buy 2 sheep for 200,000 f and fatten them and livestock feed for their food. If money is left over I will prepared ice cream to sell it.

The profits will allow me to strengthen the sale of ice cream and also my savings. What I make from this business allows me to pay for electricity and ensure daily expenses are taken care of.

loans.use: to buy 2 sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete the finishing touches on his house.

loans.name: Keyli

texts.es:
La señora Keylin Marilú  de  26 años de edad es madre soltera,  tiene  tres   hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de  San Lorenzo,  valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia.
Doña Keylin Marilú   se dedica desde hace 01 año  a la venta de abarrotería, frescos  y golosinas, es una mujer que trabaja fuerte todo los días de lunes a domingo con el objetivo de sacar adelante a su familia ya que son tres hijos pequeños que ella mantiene de alimentación y educación mas sin embargo es una mujer emprendedora que tiene dos negocio de pulpería y venta de golosinas.
Doña Keylin Marilú   sus clientes le tienen aprecio debido a su valentía y buen trato a l momento de atenderlos.
Doña Keylin Marilú  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de leche, queso, manteca, arroz, azúcar, café, pan, huevos, agua, harina, churros, refrescos, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito espera que mejore su negocio y por ende tendrá sus ganancias. 
Doña Keylin Marilú  su sueño es repellar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Abril del 2013
texts.en:
Keylin Marilú, 26 years old, is a single mother who has three children who depend on her.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras.  She has her own home.

For the past year, Keylin Marilú has made her living selling groceries, soft drinks and snacks.  She is a woman who works hard every day, from Monday to Sunday, with the goal of getting her family ahead, since she has three young children whom she supports with food and education.  Nevertheless, she is an enterprising woman who has two businesses -- a small grocery store and the sale of snacks.  Her customers appreciate her for her courage and good service when she is attending to them.  

Keylin Marilú is applying for a loan to buy milk, cheese, butter, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, eggs, water, flour, chips, soft drinks, etc.  With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her business, and thus have her earnings. 

Keylin Marilú's dream is to plaster her house.

loans.use: to buy milk, cheese, butter, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, eggs, water, flour, chips, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rizwan

texts.en: Rizwan is a 28-year-old energetic man with entrepreneurial skills. He has been operating a business as a wholesale dealer in carpets. He has been doing this business for 15 years. His clients are very satisfied with his service as he offers them good quality carpets at reasonable rates. Currently, Rizwan is planning to open a warehouse where he can store carpets and put them on display when needed. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to expand his business. He would also purchase a bigger variety of carpets to attract more customers.  Rizwan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan as this loan could be very useful for his business.

loans.use: To expand his carpet business

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita is a 47-year-old married woman with three children and lives in Getafe, Bohol. She operates a retail store business selling items like pouch vinegar and soy sauce, noodles, shampoo, soap, canned goods and bread. She has been operating her store for almost 15 years. She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more commodities to sell like beverages, condiments and toiletries. Conchita hopes that she will be successful by expanding her business and at the same time experience harmony in life.

loans.use: to buy more commodities to sell like beverages, condiments and toiletries

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is married and has five children. She is 59 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Luzminda owns and operates a plot of farmland, growing rice to sell to earn a living. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. This cropping, she requested a loan of 8,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer for the farm. In the future, she plans to buy a lot in order to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Buyannemeh

texts.en: Buyannemeh is 44 years old lives with her husband and three children in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, Purvee, runs a transportation service. Her oldest son, Gunchin, is 22 years old and daughter Davaahuu is 21 years old. Both study at university. Her youngest son, Otgonhuu, is 19 years old and a senior student at the local secondary school. Buyannemeh has been running a shoe-making business at home since 1997. She already has built close relationships with her customers and suppliers over the years. She is well-known in town from the quality of her services. She is now requesting loan of 3,000,000 MNT to pay her children's university tuition fees. She is a hard-working, modest and positive woman.

loans.use: to pay her children's university tuition fees

loans.name: Yessenia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Yessinia habita en el municipio de Nindiri junto a su esposo e hijos, sus planes a futuro es poder terminar de construir su casa, entre los dos se dividen los gastos del hogar pr que los dos trabajan para una empresa privada, con este credito que se le ha otorgado comprara Materiales para levantar una pared mas y asi cerrar de un solo la casa y poder tener mayor privacidad y seguridad, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva
texts.en:
Yessinia lives in the municipality of Nindiri with her husband and children. Her future plans are to finish building her home. Between the two of them they divide the household expenses, because both work for a private company. 

With this loan that she has been granted, she will buy materials for putting up another wall. This will effectively close off the home so that they can have greater privacy and security. She is grateful for the support from Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en: Pablita is a single, 61-year-old woman who lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Pablita owns and operates farmland, growing rice for sale to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years and earns PHP 8,000 each month. Pablita has requested a loan of PHP 11,500 to purchase fertilizer. Pablita dreams of having business to operate one day.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Kutamburahuda Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 53-year-old Rumbidzai from Masvingo. Rumbidzai is married with seven children; four are attending school.

Rumbidzai runs an agricultural related business which sells pigs. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenge she faces is the shortage of feed for the pigs. 

Rumbidzai has requested a loan of $300 to buy feed for the pigs. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to improve the general welfare of her family. 

In the future, Rumbidzai plans to expand her market and become a regional supplier of pigs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 52 years old, married, and supporting a family of three. She runs a clothing business in Kapsabet; and this has been her income generating business for the last 25 years.  She gets an average monthly profit of KES.10,000. 

She has borrowed KES. 30,000. She intends to purchase more clothes (i.e ladies dresses, T-shirts, and sweaters, among other types of clothing) for her shop. She anticipates getting profits to expand her business by increase her stock to meet client demands.

Hawa hopes to improve her living standards, and be financially stable. She also hopes to save money to pay school fees for her children, as well as to expand her business into a clothing wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes (i.e ladies dresses, T-shirts, and sweaters, among other types of clothing) for her shop

loans.name: Niyozmo

texts.ru: Ниёзмо жительница района Кумсангир. Ей 42 года. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Старший ее сын находится на заработках в России. У Ниёзмо среднее образование. Она в течение 5 лет занимается растениеводством. Ниёзмо имеет собственный небольшой участок земли, на котором выращивает овощи. К тому же Ниёзмо занимается купле-продажей мелкорогатого скота. Она трудится усердно и работает на двух работах, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Ниёзмо запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений для урожая помидора, а также закупа мелко-рогатого скота с целью откорма и продажи. За счет прибыли Ниёзмо хочет женить сына.
texts.en: Niyozmo is a resident of the Qumsangir district.  She is 42 years old, married and has two children.  Her oldest son is working in Russia.  Niyozmo has a secondary education.  She has been involved in agriculture for five years.  Niyozmo owns a small plot of land, where she grows vegetables.  In addition, Niyozmo is involved in buying and selling small livestock.  She works hard and works two jobs in order to provide for her family.  Niyozmo is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers for a tomato harvest and to buy small livestock to fatten up and resell.  Niyozmo wants to use the profit to marry off her son.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers for a tomato harvest and to buy small livestock to fatten up and resell

loans.name: Sapar

texts.ru: Сапару 54 года. Он женат и является отцом пятерых сыновей. Двое его старших сыновей обзаведены семьей и имеют детей. Сапар с женой, сыновьями, невестками и четырьмя внуками проживает в районе Носири Хусрав. В данное время его трое сыновей находятся на заработках в загранице. Его жена домохозяйка, а невестки работают учителями в сельской школе. Сапар занимается растениеводством более 15 лет. У него имеется хороший участок земли, на котором он выращивает бахчевую культуру. Кредит берет для посева арбуза и дыни и приобретения минеральных удобрений. За счет прибыли с продажи урожая Сапар хочет женить своего третьего сына.
texts.en: Sapar is 54 years old. He is married with five sons. His two oldest sons have families with children. Sapar lives in Nosiri Khusrav with his wife, sons, daughters-in-law and four grandchildren. Three of his sons are currently working abroad. His wife is a homemaker, and his daughters-in-law work as teachers in a rural school. Sapar has been involved in agriculture for over 15 years. He has a good plot of land on which he grows melons and gourds. The loan will be used to plant watermelon and cantaloupe and to buy mineral fertilizers. With the profits from selling his crops, Sapar wants to help his third son get married.

loans.use: To plant watermelon and cantaloupe and to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Risolatkhon

texts.ru: Рисолатхон 36-летняя замужняя женщина с четырьмя детьми. У нее трое сыновей и одна дочь, которые учатся в школе. Муж в данный момент находится на заработках в загранице. Рисолатхон со своей семьей проживает в районе Кубадиён. У нее среднее специальное образование. Она работает учительницей в сельской школе. Помимо работы она еще занимается и животноводством. Рисолатхон вот уже 6 лет как покупает, откармливает и перепродает скот. В деятельности ей помогают дети. Рисолатхон запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Risolatkhon is a 36-year-old married woman with four children. She has three sons and one daughter, who are enrolled in school. Her husband is currently working abroad. Risolatkhon lives with her family in Qubadiyon. She has a secondary level vocational education. She works as a teacher in a rural school. In addition to her job, she is involved in animal husbandry. Risolatkhon has been buying, raising and selling cattle for 6 years. Her children help her with her work. Risolatkhon is requesting a loan to buy and sell cattle.

loans.use: To buy and sell cattle
